column102:
Agitate well before every use! Do not dilute.
New Concrete: DECO SHINE PLUS BROWN should be applied in a uniform coat immediately after final finishing and after the surface has set and is hard to the touch. For superior finish and added durability, a second coat may be applied after the first coat has set. Coverage for new concrete is about 400-500 sq.ft./gal.
Existing Concrete: Concrete surface must be clean, dry, and free of all stains, oil, grease, dust, and other contaminants that may prevent adhesion of DECO SHINE PLUS BROWN. Apply with a short nap roller or airless sprayer, brush or squeegee. Avoid puddling or excessive build up. Allow 24 hours to dry for foot traffic. Do not use on surfaces that are subject to standing water. Allow full cure for 3-7 days before use. Coverage may vary depending on surface porosity and finish.

  During: 300 sq ft / gal
  Sealing and Dustproofing: 300 – 500 sq ft / gal
  Colored: 400 – 600 sq ft / gal

For dustproofing and sealing new and old concrete floors, the best results can be obtained by applying two thin coats. One coverage for iron aggregate and colored floors. Do not recoat in less than 4 hours. The brown pigment in DECO SHINE PLUS BROWN will make dull, faded and older floors and materials will be brighter and easier to clean and maintain.

column106:
DECO SHINE PLUS BROWN is a premium high solids, solvent based, VOC compliant, methacrylate polymer acrylic liquid for use on hard, broom and trowel finished poured concrete, and improve the wearability and durability of aged concrete surfaces. DECOSHINE BROWN will enhance the color of the slab and cement paste on exposed aggregate surfaces.

Actual/Maximum VOC content
656 grams per liter

column120: Does not provide a base for cementitious materials. Use caution around water-based coatings. Do not use under hydrostatic pressure. Two thin coats PLUS BROWN may enhance color and will not improve reflective properties of concrete. Not recommended for use on surfaces subject to constant water exposure. Heavy coats will provide a base for polymer overlays. The new coat will provide a harder, stronger seal than any other lacquer or acrylic based material. Avoid hazards by following all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheets (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.

column102: Surface Preparation: The concrete surface must be clean and free of standing water. Remove any sealer or other material that may prevent adhesion of DECO SHINE. Application to Fresh Concrete: Apply at a uniform coverage by spray or roller at 350-400 sq ft/gal. Product may be sprayed with a hand-held “pump-up” sprayer or an airless industrial sprayer. If roller applied, use a short napped solvent-resistant sleeve. When an extra high gloss is desired or on especially porous surfaces, another thin application can be applied the next day at 400 sq-ft/gal. Sealing Existing Concrete: The surface must be thoroughly cleaned and dried before applying Deco Shine. Pressure washing with a strong alkaline detergent to remove dirt, waxes and oils is recommended. Acids will not sufficiently clean or remove dirt, curing compounds, or old sealer from concrete. Worn or porous areas may need a second application for uniform sealing and appearance. Allow 24 hours before 2nd application of sealer. In general, multiple thin coats (350-400 sq ft/gal) will provide a harder, more durable finish than a single heavy application. Dry time will be influenced by both temperature and humidity.

column106: DECO SHINE is a methacrylate cure and sealer developed specifically for exterior applications, including exposed aggregate and other decorative concrete surfaces. DECO SHINE provides a clear protective coating that brings out the radiance and luster of all natural aggregate and preserves a long-lasting, durable finish. DECO SHINE is ideal for stained concrete, exposed aggregate slabs, walkways, swimming pool decks and walls.

column120: Does not provide a base for cementitious materials. Treated surfaces may be slippery when wet with rain or other liquids. (use SpecChem Surface Grip) For best results apply when concrete surfaces or ambient temperatures are between 55°F (12.8°C) and 80°F (26.7°C) Do not dilute. Use with adequate ventilation. Keep away from open flames. When sealing existing concrete, DECO SHINE may darken and highlight imperfections in hardened concrete surfaces, resulting in a mottled surface appearance. Prepare a test panel to ensure acceptable results. Do not apply in areas where there may be excessive internal water migration to the back of the film. AGITATE WELL BEFORE EVERY USE! Read the SDS before using the product. DO NOT EXPOSE TO OR APPLY NEAR FIRE OR FLAMES. FOR WELL VENTILATED OR EXTERIOR USE ONLY!

column128: Eye Contact: If product enters the eyes, flush with plenty of water or eye wash solution for several minutes. Remove contacts if present and easy to do. Seek medical attention if irritation persists. / Contact avec les yeux : Si le produit pénètre dans les yeux, rincer abondamment à l'eau ou avec une solution pour les yeux pendant plusieurs minutes. Retirer les lentilles de contact si présentes et faciles à enlever. Consulter un médecin si l’irritation persiste. Skin Contact: Wash skin thoroughly with soap and water after handling. Seek medical attention if irritation develops and persists. / Contact avec la peau : Laver soigneusement la peau avec de l’eau et du savon après manipulation. Consulter un médecin si une irritation apparaît et persiste. Inhalation: If breathing becomes difficult, remove victim to fresh air. If necessary, use artificial respiration to support vital functions. Seek medical attention. / Inhalation : Si la respiration devient difficile, transporter la victime à l’air frais. Si nécessaire, effectuer la respiration artificielle pour soutenir les fonctions vitales. Consulter un médecin. Ingestion: If product is swallowed, call physician or poison center immediately. If professional advice is not available, do not induce vomiting. Never induce vomiting or give dilutents (milk or water) to someone who is unconscious, having convulsions, or who cannot swallow. Seek medical advice. Take a copy of the label and/or SDS with the victim to the health professional. / Ingestion : En cas d’ingestion, appeler immédiatement un médecin ou un centre antipoison. Si aucun avis professionnel n’est disponible, ne pas faire vomir. Ne jamais faire vomir ni donner de diluants (lait ou eau) à une personne inconsciente, en convulsions, ou incapable d’avaler. Consulter un médecin. Fournir une copie de l’étiquette et/ou de la fiche de données de sécurité au professionnel de la santé.

Si aucun avis professionnel n’est disponible, ne pas faire vomir. Ne jamais faire vomir ni donner de diluants (lait ou eau) à une personne inconsciente, en convulsions, ou incapable d’avaler. Consulter un médecin. Fournir une copie de l’étiquette et/ou de la fiche de données de sécurité au professionnel de la santé.

column149: Surface Preparation: The concrete surface must be clean and free of standing water. Remove any sealer or other material that may prevent adhesion of DECO SHINE. Application to Fresh Concrete: Apply at a uniform coverage by spray or roller at 350-400 sq ft/gal. Product may be sprayed with a hand-held “pump-up” sprayer or an airless industrial sprayer. If roller applied, use a short napped solvent-resistant sleeve. When an extra high gloss is desired or on especially porous surfaces, another thin application can be applied the next day at 400 sq-ft/gal. Sealing Existing Concrete: The surface must be thoroughly cleaned and dried before applying Deco Shine. Pressure washing with a strong alkaline detergent to remove dirt, waxes and oils is recommended. Acids will not sufficiently clean or remove dirt, curing compounds, or old sealer from concrete. Worn or porous areas may need a second application for uniform sealing and appearance. Allow 24 hours before 2nd application of sealer. In general, multiple thin coats (350-400 sq ft/gal) will provide a harder, more durable finish than a single heavy application. Dry time will be influenced by both temperature and humidity.
column150: DECO SHINE is a methacrylate cure and sealer developed specifically for exterior applications, including exposed aggregate and other decorative concrete surfaces. DECO SHINE provides a clear protective coating that brings out the radiance and luster of all natural aggregate and preserves a long-lasting, durable finish. DECO SHINE is ideal for stained concrete, exposed aggregate slabs, walkways, swimming pool decks and walls.
column151: P501 Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local/regional/national/international regulations. / P501 Éliminer le contenu/récipient conformément à la réglementation locale/régionale/nationale/internationale.
column154: Eye Contact: If product enters the eyes, flush with plenty of water or eye wash solution for several minutes. Remove contacts if present and easy to do. Seek medical attention if irritation persists. / Contact avec les yeux : Si le produit pénètre dans les yeux, rincer abondamment à l'eau ou avec une solution pour les yeux pendant plusieurs minutes. Retirer les lentilles de contact si présentes et faciles à enlever. Consulter un médecin si l’irritation persiste. Skin Contact: Wash skin thoroughly with soap and water after handling. Seek medical attention if irritation develops and persists. / Contact avec la peau : Laver soigneusement la peau avec de l’eau et du savon après manipulation. Consulter un médecin si une irritation apparaît et persiste. Inhalation: If breathing becomes difficult, remove victim to fresh air. If necessary, use artificial respiration to support vital functions. Seek medical attention. / Inhalation : Si la respiration devient difficile, transporter la victime à l’air frais. Si nécessaire, effectuer la respiration artificielle pour soutenir les fonctions vitales. Consulter un médecin. Ingestion: If product is swallowed, call physician or poison center immediately. If professional advice is not available, do not induce vomiting. Never induce vomiting or give dilutents (milk or water) to someone who is unconscious, having convulsions, or who cannot swallow. Seek medical advice. Take a copy of the label and/or SDS with the victim to the health professional. / Ingestion : En cas d’ingestion, appeler immédiatement un médecin ou un centre antipoison. Si aucun avis professionnel n’est disponible, ne pas faire vomir. Ne jamais faire vomir ni donner de diluants (lait ou eau) à une personne inconsciente, en convulsions, ou incapable d’avaler. Consulter un médecin. Fournir une copie de l’étiquette et/ou de la fiche de données de sécurité au professionnel de la santé.
column158: Does not provide a base for cementitious materials. Treated surfaces may be slippery when wet with rain or other liquids. (use SpecChem Surface Grip) For best results apply when concrete surfaces or ambient temperatures are between 55°F (12.8°C) and 80°F (26.7°C) Do not dilute. Use with adequate ventilation. Keep away from open flames. When sealing existing concrete, DECO SHINE may darken and highlight imperfections in hardened concrete surfaces, resulting in a mottled surface appearance. Prepare a test panel to ensure acceptable results. Do not apply in areas where there may be excessive internal water migration to the back of the film. AGITATE WELL BEFORE EVERY USE! Read the SDS before using the product. DO NOT EXPOSE TO OR APPLY NEAR FIRE OR FLAMES. FOR WELL VENTILATED OR EXTERIOR USE ONLY!

column102:
Surface Preparation
The concrete surface must be clean, dry, and free of all stains, oil, grease, dust, and other contaminants that may prevent adhesion of DECO SHINE BROWN EX.

Sealing Existing Concrete
On suitable surfaces, the surface must be thoroughly cleaned and dried before application. Remove all existing coatings, waxes, curing compounds, or old sealer from concrete. Form oil or pavers may need a second application for uniform sealing and appearance. Allow 24 hours before subjecting to foot traffic. Multiple coats may be required for maximum durability and appearance. Apply in a single heavy application. Dry time will be influenced by weather conditions.

Application to Fresh Concrete
Deco Shine Brown EX should be applied only after the surface is dry. Apply at coverage rates of 250-350 sq ft/gal depending on surface porosity and finish. Apply with a short nap roller or airless sprayer. Avoid puddling or excessive build up. Allow 24 hours to dry for foot traffic. Do not use on surfaces that are subject to standing water. Allow full cure for 3-7 days before use.

Allow full cure for 3-7 days before use.
column106:
DECO SHINE BROWN EX is a brown pigmented lacquer sealer developed for interior and exterior applications. It is designed for use on aged or old hard, broom finished concrete surfaces. DECO SHINE BROWN EX, combined with a brown tinted protective coating that bridges surface and hairline cracks, is ideal for natural aggregate, porous pavements and aging, durable finish. DECO SHINE BROWN EX is fast drying, resistant to oil, grease, and alkalis.

Actual/Maximum VOC content
348 grams/liter per liter

column102:
COVERAGE
Curing, Densifying, Hardening and Dustproofing:
Hard Troweled Finish: 600-800 sq ft/gal
Broom or Float Finish: 300-400 sq ft/gal
Rough Finish: 200-300 sq ft/gal
Vertical Surface: 400-500 sq ft/gal


The above rates are approximate. Exact coverage depends upon the porosity of the concrete as well as the job requirements.
Extend application rate to 1000 sq-ft per gal with the use of a micro-fiber applicator on extremely hard trowelled, burnished concrete floors (ie Wal-Mart, Kohl’s Projects)


Apply immediately after final finishing operations and after the bleed water had receded. The use of a micro-fiber applicator will aid when applying at 800-1000 sq-ft per gal.
Over application and puddling may leave white crystals, which must be removed immediately by flushing the surface with water, scrubbing and squeegee clean.
Properly applied, cure membrane will dissipate in 3 to 5 days without subsequent coatings or treatments to produce.
May be applied with sprayer, brush or roller. Spraying provides superior results. Application temperatures 40°F to 90°F.
Protect all metal, glass, painted and black surfaces from E-Cure®. If accidentally impacted, wash with clean water.

column106:
E-Cure® is a leading edge technology, clear concrete curing compound that cures and densifies concrete as well as resolve compatibility issues related to flooring adhesives. E-Cure® is a spray applied concrete cure, hardener and dustproofer. E-Cure® penetrates and forms a temporary membrane to cure, densify, harden and dustproof concrete essential for proper strength development. E-Cure® meets the moisture retention of ASTM C309 Type 1D, Class A & B on hard-troweled concrete surfaces. May contribute to LEED credits.

  Non-yellowing, does not alter natural color of concrete
  Non-flammable/odorless/VOC Compliant
  Will not inhibit adhesion of secondary coatings, toppings, or adhesives designed for concrete
  Cure membrane dissipates in 3 - 5 days
  Resists acids, oils, greases, salts and tire marks
  USDA accepted, leaves no residue
  Certified for use on potable water structures
  Contains fugitive dye, 0 VOC’s
  Tested and certified to the performance requirements of NSF/ANSI 61
  Independently adhesion tested compliant with thin-set mortar and VCT by Tile Council of NA

column102: Surface Preparation: The concrete must be sound and free of all foreign material, including oil, grease, dust, laitance, or other surface contaminants. For maximum durability, saw cut the perimeter of the repair 1/8” deeper than the depth of the repair, creating a notched, reinforced edge. Mechanically abrade the surface by an engineer-approved method in accordance with ICRI 310.2 Guideline to a minimum CSP 5. All concrete surfaces to be repaired must be in a saturated-surface-damp (SSD) condition with no standing water on the surface. Priming/Scrub Coat: Thoroughly clean all exposed steel reinforcing of rust and coat with SpecPrep SB. Prepared concrete must be SSD and primed with a spray or brush coat of SpecPrep SB, and the repair mortar applied wet on wet or up to the recommended open time. As an alternative, apply a scrub coat of the properly mixed repair mortar by scrubbing a thin layer into the pre-dampened substrate with a stiff brush. Place the repair mortar immediately before the bond coat dries. Mixing: Mix 7.0–7.5 pints of Duo Patch Admix per 50-pound bag of material. Mix with a low-speed drill. Add the recommended amount of Duo Patch Admix into the container, followed by slowly adding the Duo Patch powder. Mix for 2-3 minutes. Mix only what can be applied within the setting period. Duo Patch can be applied in applications from 1/8” to 2” in a lift. Deep Applications: For repair applications over 1”, Duo Patch should be extended with clean, SSD, 3/8” aggregate up to 60% by weight (30 lbs) and mixed for an additional 2 minutes. This extension will add approximately 0.15 cu-ft to the unit yield and should be placed within 15-20 minutes. Placement: Trowel, screed, or pour Duo Patch firmly into the prepared area, ensuring intimate contact with the bonding surface. Finish Duo Patch level with the surrounding concrete and allow it to take an initial set. After the initial set, when Duo Patch is surface hard, finish by hand troweling. Finishing/Curing: Finish the repair material to the desired texture to best match the surrounding concrete. Do not add additional water to the surface during finishing. Lightly spray SpecFilm as a finishing aid to assist in finishing. Duo Patch is self-curing under most conditions. In severe drying conditions, use an ASTM C309-compliant, water-based SpecChem curing compound. Clean tools with water immediately after use.

Placement: Trowel, screed, or pour Duo Patch firmly into the prepared area, ensuring intimate contact with the bonding surface. Finish Duo Patch level with the surrounding concrete and allow it to take an initial set. After the initial set, when Duo Patch is surface hard, finish by hand troweling. Finishing/Curing: Finish the repair material to the desired texture to best match the surrounding concrete. Do not add additional water to the surface during finishing. Lightly spray SpecFilm as a finishing aid to assist in finishing. Duo Patch is self-curing under most conditions. In severe drying conditions, use an ASTM C309-compliant, water-based SpecChem curing compound. Clean tools with water immediately after use.
column106: Duo Patch is a two-component, polymer-modified concrete repair mortar for use in a variety of horizontal repair and form-and-pour applications. Duo Patch offers superior durability in industrial warehouses, parking decks, and roadway applications subjected to heavy loads and abrasion. Actual VOC content = 0 grams per liter.

column120: Minimum thickness for patching is 1/8”. Do not retemper after initial mixing. Do not add other cements or additives to this product. Duo Patch is a fast-setting product, so mixing equipment should be cleaned with water as soon as possible. Do not allow repairs to freeze until the material has reached a minimum of 1000 psi compressive strength. In adverse temperatures, follow ACI recommendations for hot/cold weather concreting practices. A minimum surface and ambient temperature of 45°F and rising is required at the time of application. For optimum results, condition the material to between 65°F and 85°F.**Caution**: Contains Portland Cement and sand. Cement will cause irritation. Avoid contact. A dust respirator, safety goggles, and rubber gloves are recommended. Avoid prolonged contact with clothing. In case of contact with eyes, immediately flush with water for at least 15 minutes. Get prompt medical attention. Do not wear contact lenses when working with this product. Do not take internally. Keep out of reach of children.

column149: Surface Preparation: The concrete must be sound and free of all foreign material, including oil, grease, dust, laitance, or other surface contaminants. For maximum durability, saw cut the perimeter of the repair 1/8” deeper than the depth of the repair, creating a notched, reinforced edge. Mechanically abrade the surface by an engineer-approved method in accordance with ICRI 310.2 Guideline to a minimum CSP 5. All concrete surfaces to be repaired must be in a saturated-surface-damp (SSD) condition with no standing water on the surface. Priming/Scrub Coat: Thoroughly clean all exposed steel reinforcing of rust and coat with SpecPrep SB. Prepared concrete must be SSD and primed with a spray or brush coat of SpecPrep SB, and the repair mortar applied wet on wet or up to the recommended open time. As an alternative, apply a scrub coat of the properly mixed repair mortar by scrubbing a thin layer into the pre-dampened substrate with a stiff brush. Place the repair mortar immediately before the bond coat dries. Mixing: Mix 7.0–7.5 pints of Duo Patch Admix per 50-pound bag of material. Mix with a low-speed drill. Add the recommended amount of Duo Patch Admix into the container, followed by slowly adding the Duo Patch powder. Mix for 2-3 minutes. Mix only what can be applied within the setting period. Duo Patch can be applied in applications from 1/8” to 2” in a lift. Deep Applications: For repair applications over 1”, Duo Patch should be extended with clean, SSD, 3/8” aggregate up to 60% by weight (30 lbs) and mixed for an additional 2 minutes. This extension will add approximately 0.15 cu-ft to the unit yield and should be placed within 15-20 minutes. Placement: Trowel, screed, or pour Duo Patch firmly into the prepared area, ensuring intimate contact with the bonding surface. Finish Duo Patch level with the surrounding concrete and allow it to take an initial set. After the initial set, when Duo Patch is surface hard, finish by hand troweling. Finishing/Curing: Finish the repair material to the desired texture to best match the surrounding concrete. Do not add additional water to the surface during finishing. Lightly spray SpecFilm as a finishing aid to assist in finishing. Duo Patch is self-curing under most conditions. In severe drying conditions, use an ASTM C309-compliant, water-based SpecChem curing compound. Clean tools with water immediately after use.

column185:
• Set Time at 70°F (according to ASTM C266): The initial set time is approximately 40 minutes, with a final set time around 50 minutes.
  • Compressive Strength (as per ASTM C109):
    • At 1 day, the compressive strength reaches 2,500 psi.
    • At 7 days, it increases to 4,000 psi.
    • By 28 days, the strength peaks at 6,000 psi.
  • Bond Strength (following ASTM C882 modified): After 7 days, the bond strength is measured at 1,800 psi.
  • Length Change (based on ASTM C157):
    • Wet Cure at 28 days shows a slight expansion of +0.04%.
    • Air Cure at 28 days indicates a minor contraction of -0.02%.
  • Flexural Strength (according to ASTM C348):
    • At 7 days, the flexural strength is 650 psi.
    • At 28 days, it rises to 1,300 psi.
  • Yield: Each bag yields approximately 0.42 cubic feet.

column102:
COVERAGE: Curing, hardening and dustproofing:
Trowel Finished: 600-800 sq ft / gal
Broom or Float Finish: 300-400 sq ft / gal
Rough Finish: 200-300 sq ft / gal
Vertical Surface: 400-500 sq ft / gal

The above rates are approximate. Exact coverage depends upon the porosity of the concrete as well as the job requirements. Extend application rate to 1000 sq.ft per gal with the use of a micro-fiber applicator on extremely hard troweled, burnished concrete floors (ie. Wal-Mart, Kohl’s Projects)
Apply immediately after final finishing operations and after the bleed water had receded. The use of a micro-fiber applicator will aid when applying at 800-1000 sq-ft per gal. Over application and puddling may leave white crystals, which must be removed immediately by flushing the surface with water, scrubbing and squeegee clean. May be applied with sprayer, brush or roller. Spraying provides superior results. Application temperatures 40°F to 90°F. As jobsite conditions vary, a test panel should always be performed.

column106:
E-Cure® is a leading edge concrete curing compound that was developed to cure concrete as well as solve those compatibility issues with secondary toppings, mastics and adhesives. E-Cure® is a spray applied concrete cure, hardener and dustproofer. E-Cure® penetrates concrete surfaces to densify, harden and dustproof concrete essential for strength gain. E-Cure forms a temporary membrane to help retain hydration moisture for an effective cure. E-Cure® will not alter the appearance of the concrete.

Actual VOC Content
0 grams/liter.

column102: Best results are achieved when EZ Clean & Release is applied immediately after forms are removed, before the cement scum hardens further. Apply EZ Clean & Release to concrete forms that have concrete build up at a rate of 1000-1500 sq-ft per gal. Forms with excessive build up should use a heavier application rate (500-1000 sq-ft/gal)   The EZ Clean & Release will act as a self cleaning release to your daily forming operation without removing your forms from use. Repeat until build-up and scum are removed. Aluminum forms that have developed a heavy scum coat or concrete build-up should receive a moderately heavy coat of EZ Clean & Release 24 hours before pouring. Repeat process on subsequent pours until build-up and scum are removed. Once build up is removed, resume using SpecStrip or another SpecChem reactive form release agent. Heavy Hardened Concrete: Apply EZ CLEAN & RELEASE or TRI ACT generously (100-500 ft²/gallon) to areas with existing heavy build-up. Allow build-up to soften for 6-8 hours and remove with a scraper or a power washer. Heavy build-up will generally require multiple coats to fully soften build-up. Difficult to remove build up may require the use of SPECBLAST. Protective Barrier: Use EZ Clean & Release to prevent concrete adhesion and build-up by applying to clean equipment such as chutes, shovels, screeds etc. Equipment in concrete block plants can be kept free of build-up by spraying a light coat on mixers, hoppers and chutes. Lightly spray EZ Clean & Release over the interior of concrete mixers after clean out to prevent concrete bonding. Concrete splatter will harden, but will not bond to coated surfaces and can be power washed.

column106: EZ CLEAN & RELEASE is a ready to use highly reactive petroleum mixture that, when properly applied to concrete forms with concrete build-up, will soften the hardened concrete and “self-clean” as the forms are stripped. Using EZ Clean & Release allows the poured wall contractor the ability to clean build-up from his forms without having to take the forms out of the field and out of production. EZ Clean & Release should only be used on aluminum, steel, and wood forms that have concrete build-up. EZ Clean & Release will soften and remove the build-up while also providing an effective release. Once the forms are clean, resume using SpecStrip or another SpecChem premium reactive release agent.
column107: EZ CLEAN & RELEASE is a ready to use highly reactive petroleum mixture that, when properly applied to concrete forms with concrete build-up, will soften the hardened concrete and “self-clean” as the forms are stripped. Using EZ Clean & Release allows the poured wall contractor the ability to clean build-up from his forms without having to take the forms out of the field and out of production. EZ Clean & Release should only be used on aluminum, steel, and wood forms that have concrete build-up. EZ Clean & Release will soften and remove the build-up while also providing an effective release. Once the forms are clean, resume using SpecStrip or another SpecChem premium reactive release agent.

column149: Best results are achieved when EZ Clean & Release is applied immediately after forms are removed, before the cement scum hardens further. Apply EZ Clean & Release to concrete forms that have concrete build up at a rate of 1000-1500 sq-ft per gal. Forms with excessive build up should use a heavier application rate (500-1000 sq-ft/gal)   The EZ Clean & Release will act as a self cleaning release to your daily forming operation without removing your forms from use. Repeat until build-up and scum are removed. Aluminum forms that have developed a heavy scum coat or concrete build-up should receive a moderately heavy coat of EZ Clean & Release 24 hours before pouring. Repeat process on subsequent pours until build-up and scum are removed. Once build up is removed, resume using SpecStrip or another SpecChem reactive form release agent. Heavy Hardened Concrete: Apply EZ CLEAN & RELEASE or TRI ACT generously (100-500 ft²/gallon) to areas with existing heavy build-up. Allow build-up to soften for 6-8 hours and remove with a scraper or a power washer. Heavy build-up will generally require multiple coats to fully soften build-up. Difficult to remove build up may require the use of SPECBLAST. Protective Barrier: Use EZ Clean & Release to prevent concrete adhesion and build-up by applying to clean equipment such as chutes, shovels, screeds etc. Equipment in concrete block plants can be kept free of build-up by spraying a light coat on mixers, hoppers and chutes. Lightly spray EZ Clean & Release over the interior of concrete mixers after clean out to prevent concrete bonding. Concrete splatter will harden, but will not bond to coated surfaces and can be power washed.

column102: **Admixture**: Fencement will accelerate the set, increase strength, and improve the performance of pre-mixed concrete. Mix ratios will vary depending on the speed of the initial set time desired. Blend one part dry Fencement with one to five parts pre-mixed concrete. Mix Fencement with water by hand or with a low-speed drill in a suitable container for no more than three minutes. Add water first, then powder. Mix only what can be used in five to ten minutes. Do not overmix or retemper.**Neat (full strength)**: Just add water. Mix Fencement using one to two gallons of water per 50 lb of material. Add water first, then powder. Fencement is fast-setting, so mix only as much material as can be poured in five minutes. Mix Fencement by hand or with a low-speed drill in a suitable container for no more than three minutes. Do not overmix or retemper.**Mix Ratio for High Yield**:- 1/2 gallon water per 12.5 lbs- 1 gallon water per 25 lbs- 2 gallons water per 50 lbsNote: Set time and strength development of pre-mixed concrete with Fencement as an additive could be affected by the pre-mixed concrete design. Cement substitutes in pre-mixed concrete, such as fly ash or slag, cause slower setting time and strength development, especially in cold weather. Set time of Fencement or Fencement pre-mixed concrete composition could be affected by temperatures of air, ground, material, and water. The amount of water added to the materials will also affect set times and strength developments. Additions of cold water during warm weather will extend set time. Addition of warm water (70-100°F) will accelerate the set of the materials during cool weather. Clean tools with water after use.

column106: A high-performance expansive cementitious post-anchoring cement formulated to meet the demanding requirements of the fence contractor. Fencement provides fast early compressive tensile and flexural strength. Mixed with water to a dry pack or pourable consistency, Fencement will lock itself into place. Once in place, Fencement allows the fence contractor to place and stretch the fence in the same day. Initial set will be obtained within six to eight minutes, final set after ten to fifteen minutes, depending upon the amount of water used and temperature.

column102: Ready to use. Do not dilute. Mix well prior to each use. Forms should be free from dirt, hardened concrete, or other foreign matter. Form Seasoning WB can be used at temperatures as low as 40°F, but best results are achieved if air and form temperatures are above 70°F.Form Seasoning WB can be applied with a sprayer, roller, or brush. Spray product on side rails while forms are still in stacks. Lay forms on the ground, face up. Apply Form Seasoning WB to the point of rejection, typically 300 sq ft/gal. Uniform bubbling on the form surface indicates that the product is properly reacting with the aluminum. Average reaction time is 30 minutes to 1 hour depending on the form temperature. Do not allow Form Seasoning WB to dry on the form; lightly mist with water or more Form Seasoning WB if necessary.Remove the product with a hose or low-pressure (100 psi or lower) sprayer. Do not use a high-pressure washer as the newly formed oxides on the form surface can be disturbed. Once dry, the oxides will be bonded to the surface. Forms will be dull and almost gray in color. If shiny areas are still present, a second application will be necessary. Allow forms to dry. Once dry, use a quality reactive release agent to achieve a clean release. Apply at 300 sq ft/gal to ensure proper seasoning of forms.

Uniform bubbling on the form surface indicates that the product is properly reacting with the aluminum. Average reaction time is 30 minutes to 1 hour depending on the form temperature. Do not use a high-pressure washer as the newly formed oxides on the form surface can be disturbed. Once dry, the oxides will be bonded to the surface. Forms will be dull and almost gray in color. If shiny areas are still present, a second application will be necessary. Allow forms to dry. Once dry, use a quality reactive release agent to achieve a clean release. Apply at 300 sq ft/gal to ensure proper seasoning of forms.
column106:
Form Seasoning WB is a water-based treatment for new aluminum forms. It oxidizes the elemental aluminum on the surface of new aluminum forms to properly season and prepare them for use. Once seasoned, use a quality reactive form release agent to produce a clean release. Properly seasoned aluminum forms are required to reduce sticking that can take place between aluminum and fresh concrete.
Actual/Maximum VOC content = 0 grams per liter.

column102:
Surface Preparation: The surface must be structurally sound, clean and free of dirt, release agent, efflorescence, curing compounds, laitance, and other contaminants. Remove form marks and other protrusions to prevent “show through”. Surface must have an open capillary system to provide grip for the IntraCon. If concrete has a smooth finish sandblasting is recommended to lightly roughen the concrete surface. Repair all surface defects with IntraCon Mortar. Moisten the application area and allow to dry for 10 minutes. IntraCon requires a water-saturated surface during application. Wet concrete surface thoroughly with potable water, and remove excess water (ponding) before IntraCon is applied. It is essential that the concrete surface does not dry before IntraCon is applied if concrete surface does dry rewet the area.
Mixing: Mix IntraCon with potable water to reach a thin cake batter consistency. Recommended ratios for brush application is 5 parts powder to 2 parts water. For spray application use 5 parts powder to 3 parts water. IntraCon needs to be applied within 20 minutes after mixing.

(Admixing: When IntraCon is used as additive, IntraCon must be added to the concrete in the final batching. Dosage Rate: 1.7-2.0% by weight of cement.)

For patching or repair applications use 15% of water/50 lbs bag of IntraCon.

Placement: If IntraCon is being applied by a hand brush or broom then just two mix ratios are used. Apply in a thin uniform thick coating no thicker than 1/16th of an inch. If the project requires a second application wait until the first coat has set before applying the second. A second coat should not be applied after a time period of 2 days. IntraCon should not be applied in rainy or cold conditions (below 40°F).

Application: A fine tip sprayer should be used to lightly wet the surface of the IntraCon once it has set. Typically the surface should be wet with water multiple times a day. In cases of high temperatures, winds and low humidity more applications will be necessary. IntraCon must be protected from direct sun and excessive high temperatures as drying time affects H2O hours. No covering should be in contact with the surface of the IntraCon during this time as well. If the structure is used to retain a liquid a curing length of 3 days is required and two weeks should pass before the structure is required to hold liquid.

column106: IntraCon is a cement-based, crystalline waterproofing material used to waterproof, protect, and repair above-grade and below-grade concrete. IntraCon’s unique formulation prevents liquid penetration by creating a non-soluble physical barrier over the concrete. IntraCon is recommended for any concrete structure, especially foundations, swimming pools and underground structures. IntraCon can additionally be used as a concrete waterproofing admixture.

column120: Do not retemper after initial mixing. Do not add other cements or additives to this product. INTRACON is a fast-setting product, so mixing equipment should be cleaned with water as soon as possible. Do not allow repairs to freeze until the material has reached a minimum of 1000 psi compressive strength. In adverse temperatures, follow ACI recommendations for hot/cold weather concreting practices. Use only potable water for mixing. A minimum surface and ambient temperature of 45°F and rising is required at the time of application. For optimum results, condition material to between 65°F and 85°F.**Caution**: Contains Portland Cement and sand. Cement will cause irritation. Avoid contact. A dust respirator, safety goggles, and rubber gloves are recommended. Avoid prolonged contact with clothing. In case of contact with eyes, immediately flush with water for at least 15 minutes. Get prompt medical attention. Do not wear contact lenses when working with this product. Do not take internally. Keep out of reach of children. Avoid hazards by following all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheets (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.

column128: If exposed or concerned: Get medical advice/attention. If inhaled: Remove person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing. Call a POISON CENTER/doctor if you feel unwell. If on skin: Wash with plenty of soap and water. If skin irritation or rash occurs: Get medical advice/attention. Take off contaminated clothing and wash it before reuse. If in eyes: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing. Immediately call a POISON CENTER/doctor.

column102:
INTRAFILM is designed for use during the floating and troweling stages of concrete placement. Use a clean, hand-pump tank-type sprayer with a low-pressure tip to distribute the product evenly. Lightly mist INTRAFILM over entire surface to be treated and immediately follow with screeding, floating, troweling, or other finishing procedures. INTRAFILM can also be applied after finishing as a curing aid or broom-finish. Reapply INTRAFILM to any localized areas where the concrete has begun to dry prematurely. Can also be applied both before and after dry-shake hardeners to allow surface moisture time to wet out dryshakes.


MIXING INSTRUCTIONS

INTRAFILM CONCENTRATE must be diluted with water. Contents should be stirred or shaken vigorously prior to use to eliminate any settling which may occur upon storage or shipping. The concentrate should be diluted by mixing 1-part concentrate to 4-parts clean, potable water and shake or stir until mixture is uniform. Pour diluted INTRAFILM directly into sprayer.

Can also be applied both before and after dry-shake hardeners to allow surface moisture time to wet out dryshakes.


MIXING INSTRUCTIONS

INTRAFILM CONCENTRATE must be diluted with water. Contents should be stirred or shaken vigorously prior to use to eliminate any settling which may occur upon storage or shipping. The concentrate should be diluted by mixing 1-part concentrate to 4-parts clean, potable water and shake or stir until mixture is uniform. Pour diluted INTRAFILM directly into sprayer.
column106: INTRAFILM CONCENTRATE is a reactive colloidal silica densifier and finishing aid that, when diluted with potable water at 1 to 1, fortifies freshly placed concrete for faster and easier finishing and prolonged workability in adverse conditions, such as high temperatures, high wind or low humidity. The reactive colloidal silica in INTRAFILM reacts with calcium hydroxide to create slabs with higher densification, less dusting, and lower maintenance requirements.

column120:
KEEP FROM FREEZING.

  INTRAFILM does not replace curing procedures.

  Do not store below 40°F or above 80°F (26.7°C).

  Do not stand or puddle on the surface. Over application will increase the time and bring clouding/haziness to the finish.

  Use a reduced 250 sq-ft/gal when applying multiple items or in combination with other colloidal silica treatments.

column102: Add K-Set to water. K-Set can be added to the sand, in the water, or to the complete mix. Do not add to dry cement. Do not allow K-Set to contact other additives before entering the mortar. Add K-Set at the rate of 10 to 25 oz. (283-707.5 gm) per bag of masonry cement depending upon the degree of acceleration required. For Portland Cement, add 18 to 46 oz. (509-1302 gm) of K-Set. It is recommended that the exact rate of addition be determined by testing the actual materials to be used on each job. The rates of additions given are guidelines based upon a variety of conditions and materials. Add 10-25 oz per bag of masonry cement, depending on required acceleration.

It is recommended that the exact rate of addition be determined by testing the actual materials to be used on each job. The rates of additions given are guidelines based upon a variety of conditions and materials. Add 10-25 oz per bag of masonry cement, depending on required acceleration.
column106: K-Set is a non-corrosive accelerating admixture that contains no calcium chloride. K-Set accelerates the hydration of cement, resulting in shorter setting times and high early strength. K-Set provides improved workability, helps prevent segregation, and is a substantial aid in early stiffening for mortar and stucco mixes. K-Set is an aqueous solution of organic and inorganic compounds that produces rapid heat development in the mortar, protecting it from freezing during its early life at low temperatures. K-Set is VOC compliant and specifically formulated for use in cold weather or wherever it is desirable to reduce the setting time, increase early strength, and improve mortar workability. Use K-Set to prevent the corrosive effect of calcium chloride admixtures.

K-Set is VOC compliant and specifically formulated for use in cold weather or wherever it is desirable to reduce the setting time, increase early strength, and improve mortar workability. Ingestion: If conscious, immediately give 2-4 glasses of water or milk and carefully induce vomiting. Call a physician. If splashed in eyes, wash repeatedly with clean water and call a physician.Avoid hazards by following all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheets (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.

column102: LithSeal Lite may be applied to freshly placed concrete after the final finishing and to existing (cured) concrete. Always apply LithSeal Lite to a clean surface free of cures, bond breakers, oil, dirt, grease, or debris. When necessary, clean concrete surfaces with SpecChem Citrus Cleaner. Thoroughly flush all cleaner residue from the surface and allow it to dryy. For Freshly Placed Concrete : After final finishing, apply LithSeal Lite with a quality low-pressure sprayer with a fan tip. Uniformly spread LithSeal Lite with a soft broom or microfiber applicator to thoroughly coat the concrete, eliminating any puddles or excess. Apply enough material to keep the surface wet for 15-20 minutes. Apply additional LithSeal Lite to porous areas that dry quickly.Any excess LithSeal Lite that dries on the surface will appear as a dry powder residue and can be removed with a stiff broom, power sweeper, or floor scrubbing machine. A compatible ASTM C309 curing compound such as SpecChem SpecRez may be applied to finalize the curing process.After the concrete has thoroughly cured, a floor scrubber equipped with a nylo-grit or similar abrasive cleaning pad will remove any residual construction debris, curing compound, and further enhance the LithSeal Lite surface shine.
column103: LithSeal Lite may be applied to freshly placed concrete after the final finishing and to existing (cured) concrete. Always apply LithSeal Lite to a clean surface free of cures, bond breakers, oil, dirt, grease, or debris. When necessary, clean concrete surfaces with SpecChem Citrus Cleaner. Thoroughly flush all cleaner residue from the surface and allow it to dryy. For Freshly Placed Concrete : After final finishing, apply LithSeal Lite with a quality low-pressure sprayer with a fan tip. Uniformly spread LithSeal Lite with a soft broom or microfiber applicator to thoroughly coat the concrete, eliminating any puddles or excess. Apply enough material to keep the surface wet for 15-20 minutes. Apply additional LithSeal Lite to porous areas that dry quickly.Any excess LithSeal Lite that dries on the surface will appear as a dry powder residue and can be removed with a stiff broom, power sweeper, or floor scrubbing machine. A compatible ASTM C309 curing compound such as SpecChem SpecRez may be applied to finalize the curing process.After the concrete has thoroughly cured, a floor scrubber equipped with a nylo-grit or similar abrasive cleaning pad will remove any residual construction debris, curing compound, and further enhance the LithSeal Lite surface shine.
column106: LithSeal Lite is an economical lithium silicate sealer/densifier for concrete surfaces. LithSeal Lite deeply penetrates and reacts with cured concrete. This reaction produces calcium silicate hydrate within the concrete pores. Treated surfaces remain breathable, reduce porosity, reduce dusting, reduce water permeability, and increase abrasion resistance. When properly applied, LithSeal Lite will not leave the whitish blush characteristic of other sodium silicate products. Actual VOC content = 0 grams per liter.

column102: Always apply LithSeal SG to a clean surface free of cures, bond breakers, oil, dirt, grease, or debris. Clean concrete surfaces with SpecChem Orange Peel Citrus Cleaner and neutralize with a neutral pH detergent. Thoroughly flush with water. LithSeal SG is designed to be applied at the provided concentration. Do not dilute or alter. LithSeal SG may be applied to steel troweled, honed, polished, or highly polished concrete surfaces.**Before Applying LithSeal SG**:1. Lightly wet a clean microfiber pad with LithSeal SG and wring out excess, leaving the pad damp.2. Working from one control joint to another, apply a light, fine spray of LithSeal SG to a small section of the floor using a clean pump-up sprayer fitted with a 0.5 gpm spray tip.3. Using the damp microfiber pad and firm downward pressure, immediately spread the LithSeal SG to produce a thin, even coating. Spread the product as far as possible while maintaining a wet edge. Properly applied, LithSeal SG dries quickly. Stop spreading once drying begins. Avoid overlapping.4. Allow drying to be tack-free, typically 20-60 minutes.5. Once dry, burnish LithSeal SG using a high-speed burnisher fitted with a burnishing pad or equivalent. Polishing the treated surface and high-speed burnishing heats the LithSeal SG to help the treatment fuse and bond with the concrete for increased durability and longevity.6. Repeat steps 1-5 above as necessary for the desired finish. Burnish between coats. Apply up to three coats for maximum gloss. Coverage rates will vary with concrete porosity: - Fresh, Uncured, Burnished Concrete: 600-1000 ft²/gal - Existing Steel Troweled Concrete: 400-500 ft²/gal - Existing Float Finished Concrete: 250-350 ft²/gal

column106: LithSeal SG is a water-based polymeric sealer/densifier combined with a blend of reactive lithium silicates to protect and improve the appearance of concrete floors. LithSeal SG incorporates a cross-linking nano-technology that aids penetration and adhesion, creating a tough, stain-resistant coating. LithSeal SG also contains UV absorbers that enable it to protect colored or dyed concrete against UV degradation. LithSeal SG can be used alone or in combination with other reactive sealer/densifiers such as SpecHard or LithSeal SC to give concrete floors a glossy finish, harder surface, and protective chemically resistant seal.

column102:
Concrete Surface Preparation: New Concrete must cure minimum of 5 days with oil and all curing compounds and sealers removed. Concrete must meet minimum tensile strength of 150 psi. The concrete must be prepared by diamond grinding. All oil, dirt, debris, paint and unsound concrete must be removed. The concrete surface must be prepared using mechanical methods shotblasts to a minimum ICRI Concrete Surface Profile of 3 (CSP #3). Acid etching is not acceptable. SpecChem cannot be responsible for variations in slab design, preparation, isolation or moving joints resulting from dry up, delowage, shrink or cracking after installation of vapor barrier system.


Recommended Tools: Epoxy mixing paddle, low speed drill, paint roller, squeegee, brush, or mechanical spray. All application equipment should be clean and free of contaminants prior to mixing or application.


MIXING

All materials should be acclimated to the application temperature range of 65°F to 85°F. Mix parts together as follows:
1. Open Part B hardener container and pour into the epoxy resin container labeled Part A. Add 1 - Part B to 2 - Parts A by volume.
2. Mix together for 3 minutes. Once mixed, pour some of the epoxy back into the hardener container, mix for an additional minute, then pour all the material back into the resin container, ensuring the hardener and resin are fully blended.
3. Continue mixing until no streaks remain and product is uniform. Use immediately after mixing. The epoxy must be mixed to ensure proper chemical reaction. After mixing, place immediately on the prepared surface.

column106:
MVM PRIME 5000 is a 2-component, 100% solids epoxy moisture barrier system designed to effectively stop moisture vapor related problems on concrete prior to installing SpecChem underlayments or overlayment. MVM PRIME 5000 also provides an excellent bond to concrete and can be applied to concrete as early as 5 days old where early application of floor covering is required.
Actual VOC =0 grams per liter

column128: IF SWALLOWED: Rinse mouth. DO NOT induce vomiting. IF ON SKIN (or hair): Remove/take off immediately all contaminated clothing. Rinse skin with water/shower. IF INHALED: Remove person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing. IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing. Immediately call a POISON CENTER or doctor/physician. If skin irritation or rash occurs: Get medical advice/attention. Take off contaminated clothing and wash before reuse.

column154: IF SWALLOWED: Rinse mouth. DO NOT induce vomiting. IF ON SKIN (or hair): Remove/take off immediately all contaminated clothing. Rinse skin with water/shower. IF INHALED: Remove person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing. IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing. Immediately call a POISON CENTER or doctor/physician. If skin irritation or rash occurs: Get medical advice/attention. Take off contaminated clothing and wash before reuse.
column158: Do not allow exposure to water or liquids before curing is complete. SpecChem cannot be responsible for cracks or movement of the substrate that affect the epoxy.
column166: The shelf life of properly stored MVM PRIME 5000 is two years from date of batch. Do not expose to freezing. Keep away from heat and sun. Store in a cool dry place. Keep container tightly closed when not in use. Do not store below 40°F or above 80°F. Keep away from open flames.

column102:
Storage: Store material in the original tightly closed containers. Do not allow the accumulation of water, dirt or other contaminants.

Coverage: Concentrated Orange Peel® is ready-to-use on tough jobs or follow the recommended dilution table. Field test to determine the optimal concentration for the specific application. The product will turn white when diluted with water.

Heavy Stains, Tire Marks, Cured Cutback Adhesives, Asphalt Paving Equipment – No Dilution 
Industrial Bit/grime/residual Bit/Up bondbreaker – 1 part to 4 parts water
Industrial/Institutional Warehouse Floor, General Cleaning – 1 part to 5 parts water

Use: Apply Orange Peel® to area, grime and contaminants as per the recommended dilution. Scrub or agitate as needed and allow product to dwell on the affected surface for approximately 5 minutes. Rinse thoroughly with water. Repeat if necessary. For asphalt paving equipment, rinse with power hose or floor scrubber. Thoroughly rinse with water. Stubborn stains may require additional treatments.

Stripping adhesives: Resealing and resin curing compounds will require heavy mechanical agitation and may require additional treatments. Heavy build up may require additional treatments to completely remove.

column106: Orange Peel® concentrate is a cost effective, natural citrus solvent, cleaner and degreaser. Orange Peel® is an innovative solution for the toughest industrial applications. Orange Peel® will effectively loosen, penetrate and remove grease, contaminants from architectural concrete and other surfaces. Orange Peel® can also be used to remove asphalt from tools or paving machines and dissolves many types of adhesives and contact adhesives safely and effectively. Standard harsh cleaners and degreasers are made from chlorinated solvents or hydrocarbon solvents that leave a hazardous to use and to dispose. Orange Peel® is VOC compliant with a pleasant citrus odor. (check local regulations)

column102:
Surface Preparation: The concrete must be sound and free of all foreign material, including oil, grease, dust, laitance or other surface contaminants. All surfaces to be repaired should be high pressure water blasted to produce an open rough surface profile (min CSP 3-4). Surface must be misted/dampened with water in a saturated-surface-dry (SSD) condition with no standing water on the surface. When applying in a thin overlay by broom or squeegee, be sure to scrub a bond coat into the pre-dampened surface prior to overlay to ensure proper adhesion.


Mixing: Mix by hand or with a low speed drill. Add recommended amount of water into the container, followed by slowly adding the OVERCRETE powder. Suggested mix water for OVERCRETE is approximately 2.5 to 5.75 pints per 40 LB bag (13.7%-15.0% by weight) depending on desired consistency. Mix 2-3 minutes. All product should be applied within the 25 minute working time. Do not mix longer than 3 minutes. Do not over water, over mix or re-temper.


Placement: When placing with a trowel, broom or squeegee, it may be necessary to use a squeegee to force OVERCRETE into cracks, voids and honeycombed areas. OVERCRETE should be smoothed or troweled and spread easily. For deep applications, apply in lifts allowing each layer to dry before applying the next. Additional thin OVERCRETE applications can be applied as the final overlay. Extreme weather applications should only be done to further application when all guidelines have been observed, especially heat and wind. OVERCRETE may be spray applied with a hopper gun.


CURING

OVERCRETE will reach its final cure in twenty-four hours. Protect from rain or excess water until cured.

column106:
OVERCRETE is a one-component, polymer-modified concrete repair/resurfacing mortar for smoothing, resurfacing, and restoring concrete surfaces. OVERCRETE offers superior durability for all interior and exterior concrete applications. OVERCRETE is available in 2 formulations:
OverCrete-Fine is blended with fine sands for a smoother finish on repairs from a feather to 1/2".
OverCrete-Coarse is blended with fine/coarse sands for a broom finish on repairs from 1/8" to 1.5".

column108: Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local/regional/national/international regulations.
column109: Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local/regional/national/international regulations.
column120:
Do not retemper after initial mixing. Do not add latex or other additives to this product. Mixing equipment should be cleaned with water immediately after use. Joints and cracks in the existing concrete will telegraph through the OVERCRETE overlay.
The application of a sealer like SpecChem SureSpred will minimize shrinkage and enhance the repair in exposed horizontal applications.
Do not allow repairs to freeze until the materials reach a minimum strength of 1000 psi compressive strength.
Do not apply in areas that will be subject to standing water, immersion, or ambient temperatures below 40°F. 50°F is the intended work area temperature. For subfreezing applications, condition material to between 65°F and 85°F.
Caution: Contains Portland Cement and Calcium Oxide. Contact with water will release alkali which can cause burns. Dust from this product may irritate respiratory system. Read the Safety Data Sheet before use.

Do not retemper after initial mixing. Do not add latex or other additives to this product. Mixing equipment should be cleaned with water immediately after use. Joints and cracks in the existing concrete will telegraph through the OVERCRETE overlay.
The application of a sealer like SpecChem SureSpred will improve abrasion resistance of the repair in exposed horizontal applications.
Do not allow repairs to freeze until the material has reached a minimum of 1000 psi compressive strength.
In adornments or freeze, follow ACI recommendations. Do not mix when air or substrate temperature is below 50°F. 50°F is required at the time of application. For subfreezing applications, condition material to between 65°F and 85°F.
Caution: Contains Portland Cement and Calcium Oxide. Contact with water will release alkali which can cause burns. Dust from this product may irritate respiratory system. Read the Safety Data Sheet before use.

column106:
Pave Cure AMS is a high solids white pigmented poly-alpha-Methylstyrene (AMS) concrete curing compound. When properly applied, Pave Cure AMS forms a continuous membrane that controls curing for strong and durable concrete. The white pigment reflects the sun’s rays to help keep the concrete surface cooler and to prevent excessive heat build-up. Pave Cure AMS meets maximum VOC content limits of 350 g/L for Concrete Curing Compounds as required by the U.S. EPA Architectural Coatings Rule. Pave Cure AMS is only for application on exterior, horizontal surfaces such as highway and bridge paving applications when proper curing is required.
Actual VOC Content = 345 grams/liter

Do not allow to freeze. If freezing takes place, consult SpecChem before using the product. Mixing with solvent, diesel fuel or other thinning agents is not permitted and will result in damage to the product and loss of performance.
Avoid prolonged contact with skin. If swallowed, do not induce vomiting. Call physician immediately. Avoid prolonged inhalation or contact with eyes. If swallowed, get medical attention immediately. Wear gloves, goggles, and protective clothing. Do not store in areas subject to heat or a secondary containment of the same type.
For more detailed information, consult product label and Safety Data Sheet (SDS), application labs and technical literature. Please read all information prior to using the product. Clean and thoroughly flush all equipment with warm water.

column106:
Pave Cure CW is a high solids water-based clear wax concrete curing compound. When properly applied, Pave Cure CW forms a continuous membrane that controls curing for strong and durable concrete. Pave Cure CW meets maximum VOC content limits of 350 g/L for Concrete Curing Compounds as required by the U.S. EPA Architectural Coatings Rule. Pave Cure CW is ideal for application on exterior, horizontal surfaces such as highways, airports, street and curb paving applications when proper curing is required. Pave Cure CW is available in both clear (Type I) and clear with dye (Type I-D).
Actual/Maximum VOC content = 20 grams per liter

column120: Do not allow to freeze. If freezing takes place, consult SpecChem before using the product. Do not mix or contaminate with solvent, diesel fuel or other thinning agents. Seek medical advice for other recommended cleaning agents. Do not over apply, pond or allow to puddle. Do not apply on colored concrete surfaces without prior testing. Do not apply when rain is imminent or when temperatures are below 40°F. If rain occurs prior to complete drying, a second application may be required. If further treatment is required, the manufacturer's instructions must be followed. Do not over agitate with compressed air or recirculating pump.

column150:
Pave Cure CW Caltrans is a high solids water-based clear wax concrete curing compound. When properly applied, Pave Cure CW Caltrans forms a continuous membrane that controls curing for strong and durable concrete. Pave Cure CW Caltrans meets maximum VOC content limits of 350 g/L for Concrete Curing Compounds as required by the U.S. EPA Architectural Coatings Rule. Pave Cure CW Caltrans is ideal for application on exterior, horizontal surfaces such as highways, airports, street and curb paving applications when proper curing is required. Pave Cure CW Caltrans is available in both clear (Type I) and clear with dye (Type I-D).
Actual/Maximum VOC content = 20 grams per liter

column120: Do not allow to freeze. If freezing takes place, consult SpecChem. Do not mix or contaminate with solvent, diesel fuel, or other thinning agents. Pave Cure CW leaves a wax residue which will interfere with the subsequent bonding of adhesives or paints. It must be removed mechanically or chemically if further treatment is required. If swallowed, do not induce vomiting—call a physician. column106:
Pave Cure REZ WHITE is a high solids resin based white pigmented concrete curing compound. When properly applied, Pave Cure REZ WHITE forms a continuous membrane that controls curing for strong and durable concrete. The white pigment reflects the sun’s rays to help keep the concrete surface cooler and to prevent excessive heat build-up. Pave Cure REZ WHITE meets maximum VOC content limits of 350 g/L for Concrete Curing Compounds as required by the U.S. EPA Architectural Coatings Rule.
Actual VOC content = 345 grams per liter


Pave Cure REZ WHITE is ideal for application on exterior, horizontal surfaces such as highways, airports, street and curb paving applications when proper curing is required.

column106:
Pave Cure WW is a high solids water based white pigmented concrete curing compound with selected white pigments. When properly applied, PAVE CURE WW provides an impermeable film which optimizes water retention. The white pigment reflects the sun’s rays to help keep the concrete surface cooler and to prevent excessive heat build-up. PAVE CURE WW meets maximum VOC content limits of 350 g/L for Concrete Curing Compounds as required by the U.S. EPA Architectural Coatings Rule.
Actual VOC content = 20 grams per liter


PAVE CURE WW is ideal for application on exterior, horizontal surfaces such as highways, airports, street and curb paving for excellent curing when protection from the sun’s heat is desired.

column120:
Do not allow to freeze. If freezing takes place, consult SpecChem. Do not mix or contaminate with solvent, diesel fuel or other thinning agents.
 Do not over agitate with compressed air or recirculating pump. Keep out of reach of children. Do not take internally. Do not breathe vapors. Avoid prolonged contact with skin. If swallowed, do not induce vomiting – call physician. Wear rubber gloves, goggles, and protective clothing.
 Do not use on concrete that is to accept a secondary topping without first consulting the manufacturer.
 Avoid hazards by following all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS), product labels and technical literature. Please read all information prior to using the product. Clean and thoroughly flush all equipment with warm water.
  DO NOT EXPOSE TO OR APPLY NEAR FIRE OR FLAMES. FOR WELL VENTILATED OR EXTERIOR USE ONLY!

Rates: Curing: 200 sq ft / gal New Concrete: PAVECURE WW CALTRANS should be applied as soon as the surface water has disappeared and the concrete surface will not be marred by the walking applicator. column150: PAVECURE WW CALTRANS is a high solids wax and water based white pigmented concrete curing compound. When properly applied, PAVECURE WW CALTRANS forms a continuous membrane that controls curing for strong and durable concrete. The white pigment reflects the sun’s rays to help keep the concrete surface cooler and to prevent excessive heat build-up. PAVECURE WW CALTRANS is ideal for application on exterior, horizontal surfaces such as highway and bridge paving applications when proper curing is required.

column106: PAVE CURE WW - TX TYPE II is a high solids water based white pigmented concrete curing compound. When properly applied, PAVE CURE WW - TX TYPE II forms a continuous membrane that controls curing for strong and durable concrete. The white pigment reflects the sun’s rays to help keep the concrete surface cooler and to prevent excessive heat build-up. PAVE CURE WW - TX TYPE II meets maximum VOC content limits of 350 g/L for Concrete Curing Compounds as required by the U.S. EPA Architectural Coatings Rule. PAVE CURE WW - TX TYPE II is ideal for application on exterior, horizontal surfaces such as highways, airports, street and curb paving applications when proper curing is required.

column102: Surface Preparation: Mechanically abrade existing substrate to remove all unsound concrete. Substrate must be structurally sound and free of all foreign, grease, oil, dirt or any other contaminants that may adversely affect the bond. Prepared surfaces must be dust-free and must have sufficient profile to ensure adequate mechanical lock.  Mixing and Application Guidelines: Agitate well before use.  Bonding Agent: Apply a uniform coating of undiluted PLASTER BOND at 250 sq.ft per gallon to the prepared substrate by brush, roller or sprayer. If spray applied, brush or broom into the substrate to ensure an even film over the entire area to be bonded. The open time will be when the product dries to the touch. Dry time is 20-30 min at 70°F. PLASTER BOND will remain slightly tacky when dry. Accumulation in low areas should be wiped or evenly distributed for uniform dry time. This will help prevent over-application to speed drying time. Under normal conditions, PLASTER BOND can be applied up to 24 hours before installation of plaster/adhesional toppings. All materials should be kept to a minimum.  Rewettable Applications: For rewettable applications of PLASTER BOND: Always re-tackify the bonding agent with a water mist if a continuous film is not achieved on the surface, reapply PLASTER BOND.  Place plaster or stucco within 24 hours of application.  The application instructions highlight typical conditions. (When in doubt, always apply a test patch.)   Application Rate: 250 sq.ft per gal depending on the roughness/porosity of the substrate.

Place plaster or stucco within 24 hours of application.  The application instructions highlight typical conditions. (When in doubt, always apply a test patch.) column106: PLASTER BOND is a rewettable PVA latex bonding agent designed especially for interior/exterior bonding of fresh plaster in patching, plastering and topping applications. Recommended for interior and exterior use for substrates not subjected to constant moisture, hydrostatic pressure or continuous water saturation. Can be used as an admixture to improve the adhesion and durability of interior plaster and plaster mixes to horizontal and vertical surfaces. May contribute to LEED credits.
column107: PLASTER BOND is a rewettable PVA latex bonding agent designed especially for interior/exterior bonding of fresh plaster in patching, plastering and topping applications. Recommended for interior and exterior use for substrates not subjected to constant moisture, hydrostatic pressure or continuous water saturation. Can be used as an admixture to improve the adhesion and durability of interior plaster and plaster mixes to horizontal and vertical surfaces. May contribute to LEED credits.
column108: • Coagulate the emulsion by the stepwise addition of ferric chloride and lime. • Remove the clear supernatant and flush to a chemical sewer. • For disposal, incinerate or landfill at a permitted facility in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations.

column114: Excellent Bond Strength High viscosity for optimum performance Improves the flexural strength, bond strength and impact resistance of plaster, and stucco mortars to concrete Minimizes cracks in interior, stucco and plaster when used as an admixture VOC compliant. VOC content: < 50 g/l Blue tint for visual inspection (also available in white)
column115: Excellent Bond Strength High viscosity for optimum performance Improves the flexural strength, bond strength and impact resistance of plaster, and stucco mortars to concrete Minimizes cracks in interior, stucco and plaster when used as an admixture VOC compliant. VOC content: < 50 g/l Blue tint for visual inspection (also available in white)
column120: Do not allow to freeze. Do not apply to frozen substrates, over stable paints, rust or peeling paints or whenever temperature is below 40°F. Do not use in areas subject to constant moisture, hydrostatic pressure or continuous water saturation. PLASTER BOND is not recommended as a waterproofing or vapor barrier. Apply in accordance with all safety information and first aid contained in the Material Safety Data Sheet (SDS), product labels and technical literature.

column102: Coverage: Ready-to-use. Do not dilute. Apply with a sprayer or roller in uniform thin films; spray apply for best results. Avoid puddles. Apply in accordance with recommended coverage rates. Curing, sealing & dustproofing: 300 – 400 sq ft / gal To cure broom or rough finished concrete, double the coverage rate. Coverage may vary due to porosity and condition of the concrete. Do not over apply. Freshly Poured Concrete: PolyCure should be applied as soon as the surface water has disappeared and the concrete surface will not be marred by the walking applicator. At this point, apply in a uniform coat. Existing Concrete: Do not apply PolyCure to existing concrete as a sealer. For high-gloss, durable sealer, use SpecChem Surface Shine. For dustproofing and densifying, use SpecChem Spec Hard. Before using any product, consult the appropriate tech data sheet for application instructions. PolyCure is compatible with most carpets, tile and floor covering adhesives. Due to the wide variation in the chemistry of adhesives, a test section is always recommended.

column106: POLYCURE is a VOC compliant newly engineered non-yellowing polymer solution to cure, seal, harden, and dustproof freshly placed concrete. PolyCure incorporates a new polymer technology that provides an effective and safe sealer while offering a cost effective alternative to standard acrylic cure & seals. PolyCure imparts a low gloss finish to freshly placed concrete. Benefits: PolyCure is better suited for the future application of penetrating sealers and hardeners than traditional acrylic cure & seals.

column120: For application of secondary topping or coatings, ensure that the surface is in accordance with the manufacturer’s written instructions. Does not provide a base for cementitious materials. Not for use in fountains or pools. When used over colored concrete, PolyCure may enhance color variation or imperfections. Prepare a test panel to ensure acceptable results. Rubber wheeled vehicles may leave black marks. Do not apply to existing concrete as a sealer. Contact SpecChem Technical Services for complete application instructions and limitations. DO NOT CUT OR WELD CONTAINER KEEP AWAY FROM OPEN FLAME INDUSTRIAL USE ONLY Additional precautions, safety information and first aid are contained in the Material Safety Data Sheet. DO NOT EXPOSE TO OR APPLY NEAR FIRE OR FLAMES. FOR WELL VENTILATED OR EXTERIOR USE ONLY!

column102:
Substrate Preparation: The concrete must be at least 28 days old and fully cured. The hole must be free of particles and debris. Water-scrub sides and bottom with stiff scrub brush. Remove excess water. The hole must be clean and uniformly damp. Always use the appropriate flat washer for the size bolt you are anchoring. Place bolt in hole with head down and washer resting on the head.


Mixing and Interior Applications: Add a 1/2 quart (16 oz.) of clean potable water to every 5 pounds of POR-ROK® and mix to a smooth, flowable consistency. If mixing smaller amounts by hand mix 3.2 oz. water for every 1 pound of POR-ROK®. Once the mix is lump free, pour the material around the bolt or anchor. Fill the material slightly above substrate level. DO NOT LEAVE THE POR-ROK® SET WHERE WATER CAN PUDDLE AROUND THE BOLT OR ANCHOR. For applications that require a more plastic-like consistency, reduce the amount of water slightly until the desired consistency is achieved.


Exterior Applications: When using Por-Rok® Products for exterior applications where excessive standing water is present, CGM recommends the use of Super Por-Rok®. In cases where aluminum railings are being installed, CGM HIGHLY recommends the use of Super Por-Rok® for all environmental conditions; however one of the two following options MUST be used in standing water environments to achieve optimum bond strength and performance. 
OPTION 1: Once the POR-ROK® is set (15 min.), mix and additional amount of POR-ROK® with slightly less water and cone the material above the anchor. Prevent water from settling on the surface and possibly damaging the installation. 
OPTION 2: Fill the hole with POR-ROK® flush to the top of the concrete. 7 days after installation seal with any sealer rated for exterior use. FAILURE TO PROPERLY MITIGATE STANDING WATER FROM POR-ROK® WILL RESULT IN POSSIBLE PRODUCT FAILURE.


Color: Off White
Approximate Coverage: 50 lbs. of POR-ROK® will cover 5 cubic feet
Weight: 110 lbs. per cubic foot
Application Temperature Range: 35° - 95°F
Set: ASTM C-191 (70°F—50% RH)
Volatile Organic Compounds: 0 g/l

column106: POR-ROK® Anchoring Cement is used in the anchoring of heavy machinery, railings, guard rails, bannisters, repairing of cracks on damaged concrete substrate. It is a non-shrink, hydraulic controlled expansion cement in a ready to use preparation. Water is added at the job site to provide a pourable, durable anchoring or patching compound. POR-ROK® Anchoring Cement has almost unlimited field applications.

column120:
1. DO NOT OVER-WATER POR-ROK®. Over-watering can inhibit long term strength and durability.
2. POR-ROK® should be poured slightly above substrate level. Leaving a depression would allow water to settle in the application and weaken its integrity over time.
3. The hole to accept the bolt or anchor should not be drilled within 4" of the corner or the edge of the concrete substrate.
4. DO NOT INSTALL POR-ROK® where the application temperature has been below 32 degrees during the 24 hours before installation or will fall below 32 degrees during the 24 hours after installation.
5. If a smooth surface is desired a flat trowel can be used when POR-ROK® begins to stiffen.

column102:
Joint preparation: Joints must be clean, dry and free of curing compound, densifiers, sealers and any other foreign substances. To remove the above, use a vacuum equipped, dry cut abrasive blade and oil-free compressed air to remove any debris and dust prior to applying RAPID FLEX CJ.


Per ACI and PCA guidelines, Rapid Flex CJ should be installed full depth in sawcut control joints and a minimum of 2/3 joint depth in random cracks. No joint sealer or compressible backer rod is required. RAPID FLEX CJ should be applied to a minimum depth of 1/2 inch.


Mixing instructions: Temperature of RAPID FLEX CJ must be 50°F or above at the time of mixing. Stir/shake each component before dispensing. Use a 1:1 low pressure dual-component, proportioned metered pump with a 3/8” x 24” element static mixer.


Application: When using a cartridge or plural component pump, dispense mixed material into a waste container to assure a uniform color and a consistent 1:1 ratio. Then dispense properly mixed RAPID FLEX CJ into the prepared joint. Joints should be overfilled and allowed to cure for approximately 1 hour and up to 24 hours before shaving flush with a floor razor scraper. The cut joint must be flush with the floor to effectively transfer wheel loads.


Stain Protection: Since RAPID FLEX CJ sets so quickly, the potential for any overfill to stain the sides of the joint is unlikely. In applications where aesthetic and decorative or architectural finishes are critical, we recommend using Spec CJ Guard as a stain protectant and also to facilitate shaving.


If RAPID FLEX CJ is installed in a floor before maximum shrinkage has occurred, a crack may appear either adhesively or cohesively. This should not be considered a failure of the RAPID FLEX CJ, which will continue to support the joint edge and transfer wheel loads. To remedy the situation, clean and out the crack, wipe clean with SpecChem Solvent 100 and refill with RAPID FLEX CJ.

column106: RAPID FLEX CJ is a 100% solids, two-component, UV resistant, semi-rigid, rapid-setting, polyurea for filling control and construction joints in heavy duty industrial concrete floors. RAPID FLEX CJ allows for joints to be shaved quickly for fast turnaround. RAPID FLEX CJ has been designed for use in compliance with ACI 302, section 4.10 recommendations for joint fillers used in saw cut/control joints with a Shore A Durometer of 85. RAPID FLEX CJ can also be used for the repair of damaged or spalled joint nosing and cracks. RAPID FLEX CJ is also available in 4 additional architectural colors. (see RapidFlex Colorant System)
column107: RAPID FLEX CJ is a 100% solids, two-component, UV resistant, semi-rigid, rapid-setting, polyurea for filling control and construction joints in heavy duty industrial concrete floors. RAPID FLEX CJ allows for joints to be shaved quickly for fast turnaround. RAPID FLEX CJ has been designed for use in compliance with ACI 302, section 4.10 recommendations for joint fillers used in saw cut/control joints with a Shore A Durometer of 85. RAPID FLEX CJ can also be used for the repair of damaged or spalled joint nosing and cracks. RAPID FLEX CJ is also available in 4 additional architectural colors. (see RapidFlex Colorant System)
