column102:
Surface Preparation: The concrete must be sound and free of all foreign material, including oil, grease, dust, laitance, or other surface contaminants. For maximum durability, saw cut the perimeter of the repair 1/8” deeper than the depth of the repair, creating a notched, reinforced edge. Mechanically abrade the surface by an engineered approved method in accordance with ICRI 310.2 Guideline to a minimum CSP 5. All concrete surfaces to be repaired must be in a saturated-surface-damp (SSD) condition with no standing water on the surface.Priming/Scrub Coat: Thoroughly clean all exposed steel reinforcing of rust and coat with SpecPrep SB. Prepared concrete must be SSD and primed with a spray or brush coat of SpecPrep SB, and the repair mortar applied wet-on-wet or up to the recommended open time (see SpecPrep SB technical data sheet).Mixing: Mix 6.75 – 7.25 pints (depending on desired consistency) of clean water per 50-pound bag of material. Mix with a low-speed drill. Add the recommended amount of clean water into the container, followed by SpecPatch (15 Minute). Mix for 2 to 3 minutes. Mix only what can be applied within the setting period. SpecPatch (15 Minute) may be used with SpecChem Acrylic Bonder neat or mixed 1 to 1 with water per 50 pounds of powder to increase durability, abrasion resistance, and bond strength.Bond/Scrub Coat: Use the properly mixed SpecPatch (15 Minute) as a bond or scrub coat by scrubbing a thin layer into the pre-dampened substrate with a stiff brush. Place the SpecPatch (15 Minute) mortar immediately before the bond coat dries.Placement: Trowel SpecPatch (15 Minute) firmly into the prepared area, ensuring intimate contact with the bonding surface. Use slightly more material than is needed and roughly shape it during placement. After the initial set, when SpecPatch (15 Minute) is surface hard, shave the material to the desired final shape using a steel trowel. Maximum depth of neat repair mortar is 1” for each lift. Additional lifts can be placed after the original lift has achieved set.Finishing/Curing: Finish the repair material to the desired texture to match the surrounding concrete. SpecPatch (15 Minute) is self-curing under most conditions. In severe drying conditions, use an ASTM C309-compliant, water-based SpecChem curing compound.
WHMIS Classification: Class E, D2B (Corrosive, Toxic)

column106: SpecPatch (15 Minute) is a general-purpose concrete repair mortar for concrete floors, walls, PRECAST, tilt-up, and masonry surfaces. SpecPatch (15 Minute) can be used for horizontal and vertical applications to provide a durable repair that can be shaped by shaving or sanding.
column107: SpecPatch (15 Minute) is a general-purpose concrete repair mortar for concrete floors, walls, PRECAST, tilt-up, and masonry surfaces. SpecPatch (15 Minute) can be used for horizontal and vertical applications to provide a durable repair that can be shaped by shaving or sanding.

column120: Minimum thickness for repair is 1/8” to achieve maximum durability in heavy wear applications. Do not retemper after initial mixing. Do not add other cements or additives to this product. SpecPatch (15 Minute) is a fast-setting product, so mixing equipment should be cleaned with water as soon as possible. Do not allow repairs to freeze until the material has reached a minimum of 1000 psi compressive strength. In adverse temperatures, follow ACI recommendations for hot/cold weather concreting practices. Use only potable water for mixing. A minimum surface and ambient temperature of 45°F and rising is required at the time of application. For optimum results, condition material to between 65°F and 85°F.Caution: Contains Portland Cement and sand. Cement will cause irritation. Avoid contact. A dust respirator, safety goggles, and rubber gloves are recommended. Avoid prolonged contact with clothing. In case of contact with eyes, flush with water for at least 15 minutes. Get prompt medical attention. Do not wear contact lenses when working with this product. DO NOT take internally. Keep out of reach of children. Avoid hazards by following all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.

column149:
Surface Preparation: The concrete must be sound and free of all foreign material, including oil, grease, dust, laitance, or other surface contaminants. For maximum durability, saw cut the perimeter of the repair 1/8” deeper than the depth of the repair, creating a notched, reinforced edge. Mechanically abrade the surface by an engineered approved method in accordance with ICRI 310.2 Guideline to a minimum CSP 5. All concrete surfaces to be repaired must be in a saturated-surface-damp (SSD) condition with no standing water on the surface.Priming/Scrub Coat: Thoroughly clean all exposed steel reinforcing of rust and coat with SpecPrep SB. Prepared concrete must be SSD and primed with a spray or brush coat of SpecPrep SB, and the repair mortar applied wet-on-wet or up to the recommended open time (see SpecPrep SB technical data sheet).Mixing: Mix 6.75 – 7.25 pints (depending on desired consistency) of clean water per 50-pound bag of material. Mix with a low-speed drill. Add the recommended amount of clean water into the container, followed by SpecPatch (15 Minute). Mix for 2 to 3 minutes. Mix only what can be applied within the setting period. SpecPatch (15 Minute) may be used with SpecChem Acrylic Bonder neat or mixed 1 to 1 with water per 50 pounds of powder to increase durability, abrasion resistance, and bond strength.Bond/Scrub Coat: Use the properly mixed SpecPatch (15 Minute) as a bond or scrub coat by scrubbing a thin layer into the pre-dampened substrate with a stiff brush. Place the SpecPatch (15 Minute) mortar immediately before the bond coat dries.Placement: Trowel SpecPatch (15 Minute) firmly into the prepared area, ensuring intimate contact with the bonding surface. Use slightly more material than is needed and roughly shape it during placement. After the initial set, when SpecPatch (15 Minute) is surface hard, shave the material to the desired final shape using a steel trowel. Maximum depth of neat repair mortar is 1” for each lift. Additional lifts can be placed after the original lift has achieved set.Finishing/Curing: Finish the repair material to the desired texture to match the surrounding concrete. SpecPatch (15 Minute) is self-curing under most conditions. In severe drying conditions, use an ASTM C309-compliant, water-based SpecChem curing compound.
WHMIS Classification: Class E, D2B (Corrosive, Toxic)
column150: SpecPatch (15 Minute) is a general-purpose concrete repair mortar for concrete floors, walls, PRECAST, tilt-up, and masonry surfaces. SpecPatch (15 Minute) can be used for horizontal and vertical applications to provide a durable repair that can be shaped by shaving or sanding.
column151: Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local/regional/national/international regulations.
column154: IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Call a doctor immediately. IF ON SKIN: Wash with water.
column158: Minimum thickness for repair is 1/8” to achieve maximum durability in heavy wear applications. Do not retemper after initial mixing. Do not add other cements or additives to this product. SpecPatch (15 Minute) is a fast-setting product, so mixing equipment should be cleaned with water as soon as possible. Do not allow repairs to freeze until the material has reached a minimum of 1000 psi compressive strength. In adverse temperatures, follow ACI recommendations for hot/cold weather concreting practices. Use only potable water for mixing. A minimum surface and ambient temperature of 45°F and rising is required at the time of application. For optimum results, condition material to between 65°F and 85°F.Caution: Contains Portland Cement and sand. Cement will cause irritation. Avoid contact. A dust respirator, safety goggles, and rubber gloves are recommended. Avoid prolonged contact with clothing. In case of contact with eyes, flush with water for at least 15 minutes. Get prompt medical attention. Do not wear contact lenses when working with this product. DO NOT take internally. Keep out of reach of children. Avoid hazards by following all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.
column166: Shelf life of unopened bags stored in a dry facility is 12 months, and 18 months for product packaged in pails. Excessive temperature differential and/or high humidity can shorten the shelf life expectancy. Store in a cool, dry area away from direct sunlight.

column185:
Technical Specifications:

  • Initial set time of 15 – 30 minutes and final set in 60 minutes at 70°F, following ASTM C266 standards.
  • Compressive strength reaches 1200 psi in 3 hours, peaking at 6200 psi over 28 days.
  • Exhibits minimal shrinkage and outstanding freeze-thaw resistance with no scaling after 25 cycles.
  • Slant shear bond strength of 1620 psi after 7 days and flexural strength of 650 psi at 28 days.

column102:
Surface Preparation: The concrete must be sound and free of all foreign material, including oil, grease, dust, laitance, or other surface contaminants. For maximum durability, saw cut the perimeter of the repair 1/8” deeper than the depth of the repair, creating a notched, reinforced edge. Mechanically abrade the surface by an engineered approved method in accordance with ICRI 310.2 Guideline to a minimum CSP 5. All concrete surfaces to be repaired must be in a saturated-surface-damp (SSD) condition with no standing water on the surface.Priming/Scrub Coat: Thoroughly clean all exposed steel reinforcing of rust and coat with SpecPrep SB. Prepared concrete must be SSD and primed with a spray or brush coat of SpecPrep SB. Apply the repair mortar wet-on-wet or up to the recommended open time (see SpecPrep SB technical data sheet).Mixing: Mix 6.75 – 7.25 pints (depending on desired consistency) of clean water per 50-pound bag of material. Mix with a low-speed drill. Add the recommended amount of clean water into the container, followed by SpecPatch. Mix for 2 to 3 minutes. Mix only what can be applied within the setting period. SpecPatch may be used with SpecChem Acrylic Bonder neat or mixed 1:1 with water per 50 pounds of powder to increase durability, abrasion resistance, and bond strength. The addition of Acrylic Bonder is recommended for thin, horizontal applications subjected to heavy traffic or wear.Bond/Scrub Coat: Use the properly mixed SpecPatch as a bond or scrub coat by scrubbing a thin layer into the pre-dampened substrate with a stiff brush. Place the SpecPatch mortar immediately before the bond coat dries.Placement: Trowel SpecPatch firmly into the prepared area, ensuring intimate contact with the bonding surface. Use slightly more material than is needed and roughly shape it during placement. After the initial set, when SpecPatch is surface hard, shave the material to the desired final shape using a steel trowel. Maximum depth of neat repair mortar is 1” for each lift. Additional lifts can be placed after the original lift has set, leaving the surface rough to improve the bond between lifts.Finishing/Curing: Finish the repair material to match the texture of the surrounding concrete. SpecPatch is self-curing under most conditions. In severe drying conditions, use an ASTM C-309-compliant, water-based SpecChem curing compound.
WHMIS Classification: Class E, D2B (Corrosive, Toxic)

Seek medical attention. Do not wear contact lenses when working with this product. DO NOT take internally. Keep out of reach of children. Follow all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.

column102:
Surface Preparation: The concrete must be sound and free of all foreign material, including oil, grease, dust, laitance, or other surface contaminants. For maximum durability, saw cut the perimeter of the repair 1/8” deeper than the depth of the repair, creating a notched, reinforced edge. Mechanically abrade the surface by an engineered approved method in accordance with ICRI 310.2 Guideline to a minimum CSP 5. All concrete surfaces to be repaired must be in a saturated-surface-damp (SSD) condition with no standing water on the surface.Priming/Scrub Coat: Thoroughly clean all exposed steel reinforcing of rust and coat with SpecPrep SB. Prepared concrete must be SSD and primed with a spray or brush coat of SpecPrep SB, and the repair mortar applied wet-on-wet or up to the recommended open time (see SpecPrep SB technical data sheet).Mixing: Mix 6.75 – 7.25 pints (depending on desired consistency) of clean water per 50-pound bag of material. Mix with a low-speed drill. Add the recommended amount of clean water into the container, followed by SpecPatch 5. Mix for 2 to 3 minutes. Mix only what can be applied within the setting period. SpecPatch 5 may be used with SpecChem Strong Bond Acrylic Bonder neat or mixed 1 to 1 with water per 50 pounds of powder to increase durability, abrasion resistance, and bond strength.Bond/Scrub Coat: Use the properly mixed SpecPatch 5 as a bond or scrub coat by scrubbing a thin layer into the pre-dampened substrate with a stiff brush. Place the SpecPatch 5 mortar immediately before the bond coat dries.Placement: Trowel SpecPatch 5 firmly into the prepared area, ensuring intimate contact with the bonding surface. Use slightly more material than is needed and roughly shape it during placement. After the initial set, when SpecPatch 5 is surface hard, shave the material to the desired final shape using a steel trowel. Maximum depth of neat repair mortar is 1” for each lift. Additional lifts can be placed after the original lift has achieved set.Finishing/Curing: Finish the repair material to the desired texture to match the surrounding concrete. SpecPatch 5 is self-curing under most conditions. In severe drying conditions, use an ASTM C309-compliant, water-based SpecChem curing compound.
WHMIS Classification: Class E, D2B (Corrosive, Toxic)

column106: SpecPatch 5 is a general-purpose concrete repair mortar for concrete floors, walls, precast, tilt-up, and masonry surfaces. SpecPatch 5 can be used for horizontal and vertical applications to provide a durable repair that can be shaped by shaving or sanding.

column120: Minimum thickness for repair is 1/8” to achieve maximum durability in heavy wear applications. Do not retemper after initial mixing. Do not add other cements or additives to this product. SpecPatch 5 is a fast-setting product, so mixing equipment should be cleaned with water as soon as possible. Do not allow repairs to freeze until the material has reached a minimum of 1000 psi compressive strength. In adverse temperatures, follow ACI recommendations for hot/cold weather concreting practices. Use only potable water for mixing. A minimum surface and ambient temperature of 45°F and rising is required at the time of application. For optimum results, condition material to between 65°F and 85°F.Caution: Contains Portland Cement and sand. Cement will cause irritation. Avoid contact. A dust respirator, safety goggles, and rubber gloves are recommended. Avoid prolonged contact with clothing. In case of contact with eyes, flush with water for at least 15 minutes. Get prompt medical attention. Do not wear contact lenses when working with this product. DO NOT take internally. Keep out of reach of children. Avoid hazards by following all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.

column185:
Technical Specifications:

  • Initial set in 5 minutes, with a final set in 8 minutes at 70°F, according to ASTM C266.
  • Compressive strength reaches 1500 psi in 3 hours, with a maximum of 6000 psi over 28 days.
  • Minimal shrinkage and excellent freeze-thaw durability, with no scaling after 25 cycles.
  • Slant shear bond strength of 1680 psi after 7 days and a flexural strength of 650 psi at 28 days.

column102:
Surface Preparation: The concrete must be sound and free of all foreign material, including oil, grease, dust, laitance or other surface contaminants. For maximum durability, saw cut the perimeter of the repair 1/8” deeper than the depth of the repair, creating a notched, reinforced edge. Mechanically abrade the surface by an engineered approved method in accordance with ICRI 310.2 Guideline to a minimum CSP 5. All concrete surfaces to be repaired must be in a saturated-surface-damp (SSD) condition with no standing water on the surface.
              
              Priming/Scrub Coat: Thoroughly clean all exposed steel reinforcing of rust and coat with SpecPrep SB. Prepared concrete must be SSD and primed with a spray or brush coat of SpecPrep SB and the repair mortar applied wet on wet or up to the recommended open time (see SpecPrep SB technical data sheet).
              
              SpecPatch Light takes its initial set in 15 minutes.
              
              Mixing: Mix 6.75 – 7.25 pints (depending on desired consistency) of clean water per 50 pound bag of material. Mix with a low speed drill. Add recommended amount of clean water into the container, followed by the SpecPatch Light. Mix 2 to 3 minutes. Mix only what can be applied within the setting period. SpecPatch Light may be used with SpecChem Acrylic Bonder neat or mixed 1 to 1 with water per 50 pounds of powder to increase durability, abrasion resistance and bond strength. The addition of Acrylic Bonder is recommended when using SpecPatch Light in thin, horizontal applications subjected to heavy traffic or wear.
              
              Bond/Scrub Coat: Use the properly mixed SpecPatch Light as a bond or scrub coat by scrubbing a thin layer into the pre-dampened substrate with a stiff brush. Place the SpecPatch Light mortar immediately before the bond coat dries.
              
              Placement: Trowel SpecPatch Light firmly into the prepared area, ensuring intimate contact with the bonding surface. Use slightly more material than is needed and roughly shape during placement. After the initial set, when SpecPatch Light is surface hard, shave the material to the desired final shape using a steel trowel. Maximum depth of neat repair mortar is 1” for each lift. Additional lifts can be placed after the original lift has achieved set. The original lift should be left with a rough surface to improve bond between lifts.
              
              Finishing/Curing: Finish the repair material to the desired texture to match the surrounding concrete. SpecPatch Light is self-curing under most conditions. In severe drying conditions, use an ASTM C-309 compliant, water based SpecChem curing compound.

column120:
Minimum thickness for repair is 1/8” to achieve maximum durability in heavy wear applications. Do not retemper after initial mixing. Do not add other cements or additives to this product. SpecPatch Light is a fast setting product, so mixing equipment should be cleaned with water as soon as possible. Do not allow repairs to freeze until the material has reached a minimum of 1000 psi compressive strength. In adverse temperatures, follow ACI recommendations for hot/cold weather concreting practices. Use only potable water for mixing. Minimum surface and ambient temperature of 45°F and rising is required at the time of application. For optimum results, condition material to between 65° F and 85°F.
              
              Caution: Contains Portland Cement and sand. Cement will cause irritation. Avoid contact. A dust respirator, safety goggles, and rubber gloves are recommended. Avoid prolonged contact with clothing. In case of contact with eyes, immediately flush with water for at least 15 minutes. Get prompt medical attention. Do not wear contact lenses when working with this product. DO NOT take internally. Keep out of reach of children. Avoid hazards by following all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS), product labels, and technical literature. Please read this information prior to using the product.

column128: IF exposed or concerned: Get medical advice/attention / EN CAS d’exposition prouvée ou suspectée : consulter un médecin IF INHALED: Remove person to fresh air and keep comfortable for breathing. Call a POISON CENTER/doctor if you feel unwell / EN CAS D’INHALATION : transporter la personne à l’air frais et la maintenir au repos. Appeler un CENTRE ANTIPOISON/un médecin en cas de malaise IF ON SKIN: Wash with plenty of water. If skin irritation or rash occurs: Get medical advice/attention. Take off contaminated clothing and wash it before reuse / EN CAS DE CONTACT AVEC LA PEAU : laver abondamment à l'eau. En cas d’irritation ou d’éruption cutanée : consulter un médecin. Enlever les vêtements contaminés et les laver avant réutilisation IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing. Immediately call a POISON CENTER/Doctor / EN CAS DE CONTACT AVEC LES YEUX : rincer avec précaution à l'eau pendant plusieurs minutes. Enlever les lentilles de contact si elles sont présentes et faciles à enlever. Continuer à rincer. Appeler immédiatement un CENTRE ANTIPOISON/un médecin

column184:
Technical Specifications:

  • Sets within 15-60 minutes at 70°F as per ASTM C266.
  • Achieves compressive strength from 950 psi in 3 hours up to 6000 psi over 28 days.
  • Exhibits minimal shrinkage and excellent freeze-thaw resistance, with no scaling after 25 cycles.
  • Provides a slant shear bond strength of 1680 psi after 7 days and flexural strength of 650 psi at 28 days.

column102:
Surface Preparation: Ensure the surface is clean, free of contaminants, and properly prepared according to ACI guidelines. Apply a bond coat of SpecPoxy 1000, ensuring complete coverage.Placing: Once the concrete is placed, screeded, tamped, and floated, apply the first 2/3 of the SpecPlate Floor Hardener coverage, allowing it to absorb moisture from the slab. Float the material into the surface using a bull float or power trowel. Apply the remaining 1/3 of the hardener, float again, and finish the surface using a power trowel. Ensure the hardener is fully integrated into the top surface of the slab.Finishing: After the surface has sufficiently stiffened, apply SpecFilm as a finishing aid and continue troweling. Use a hard troweled surface for maximum durability. Do not add water to aid in finishing.Curing: Apply an ASTM C-309 compliant curing compound after final troweling.
SCAQMD Rule 1113 compliant

column106: SpecPlate Floor Hardener is a metallic dry-shake hardener designed to provide superior abrasion resistance and durability for interior concrete floors. SpecPlate Floor Hardener is ideal for industrial environments subjected to heavy traffic and abrasion. It is applied during the concrete finishing process to become an integral part of the surface, providing long-lasting protection.

column120: Do not place at temperatures below 40°F (5°C) or if the temperature is expected to fall below 40°F (5°C) within the next 24 hours. Avoid the use of dry-shake hardeners where floors will be exposed to acids or chemicals that attack Portland cement. Do not exceed a slump of 4” (10.16 cm). Avoid air entrainment in the concrete, ensuring that total air content does not exceed 3%. Do not use calcium chloride or aggregates contaminated by saltwater.Caution: Contains Portland cement and sand. Avoid contact with skin and eyes. Use a dust respirator, safety goggles, and rubber gloves. In case of eye contact, flush with water for 15 minutes and seek medical attention. Do not take internally. Keep out of reach of children. Follow all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS).

column102:
Surface Preparation: Prepare the concrete with a scrabbler, shotblasting, or milling machine to remove any unsound surfaces. Prime all surfaces with SpecPoxy 1000 at 75-100 sq. ft. per gallon. Apply with a notched squeegee, broom, or roller to ensure complete coverage. While the epoxy is still wet (max. 30 minutes), broadcast with dry sand to the point of refusal (approximately 1 lb of dry sand per sq. ft.). Allow to dry a minimum of 12 hours and remove any loose sand with a broom and vacuum before applying the topping.Mixing: A paddle mixer is recommended for proper mixing. Add approximately 85% of the required water for a 3-4 bag batch. Add the SpecPlate Floor Topping and mix for approximately 2 minutes. Then, add the remaining water and mix thoroughly to achieve a 5” to 7” slump. Use 5.0 to 6.0 pints (2.4-2.8 L) per bag.Placing: Apply the mixed topping to the cured epoxy/sand bond coat. Screed and bull float to the proper elevation. Apply SpecFilm to prevent rapid drying of the topping.Finishing: Float the surface once the topping has stiffened enough to support the weight of a power float. Steel trowel finishing will provide the most durable topping surface. Avoid over-finishing.Curing: Use SpecRez as a curing compound applied at 200 sq. ft. per gallon.Control Joints: Exposed control and construction joints should be cut and filled with SpecPoxy CJ.
SCAQMD Rule 1113 compliant

column120: Do not place at temperatures below 40°F (5°C) or if the temperature is expected to fall below 40°F (5°C) within the next 24 hours. Do not use dry-shake hardeners where floors will be exposed to materials known to attack Portland cement, such as acids. Slump should not exceed 4” (10.16 cm). Do not use any air entrainment. Total air in the concrete mix should not exceed 3%. Do not use calcium chloride or aggregates contaminated by saltwater.Caution: Contains Portland Cement and sand. Cement will cause irritation. Avoid contact. A dust respirator, safety goggles, and rubber gloves are recommended. Avoid prolonged contact with clothing. In case of contact with eyes, flush with water for at least 15 minutes. Seek medical attention. Do not wear contact lenses when working with this product. DO NOT take internally. Keep out of reach of children. Follow all precautions found in the Safety Data Sheet (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.

column102:
Recommended for:- Bonding concrete, steel, and wood- Gravity feed crack repairs- Pressure injection of hairline cracksMixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F prior to mixing or installation. Precondition the material to 75°F to assist with mixing and dispensing. For bulk applications, mix two parts of component A and one part of component B by volume for three minutes using a low-speed drill motor with a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot life. For cartridges, the resin and hardener are uniformly dispensed and mixed simultaneously through a mixing nozzleSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and other foreign matter by sandblasting, mechanical abrasion, or oil-free compressed air. For pressure injection, prepare the surface adjacent to the cracks to expose clean, sound concrete.Crack Injection: Injection ports should be fastened to the surface of the concrete using SpecPoxy 3000 FS. The injection ports should be spaced approximately 6” to 24” apart depending upon the crack width and the thickness of the concrete. The surface of the crack should also be sealed using SpecPoxy 3000 FS, overlapping the crack approximately 1-1/2” on both sides. After the ports and crack surface have cured, inject SpecPoxy 1000 with pressurized dispensing equipment or use cartridges.Bonding: As a structural adhesive, apply SpecPoxy 1000 neat and work it into the substrate. The glue line should not exceed 1/16”.
Meets ASTM C881 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

For pressure injection, prepare the surface adjacent to the cracks to expose clean, sound concrete.Crack Injection: Injection ports should be fastened to the surface of the concrete using SpecPoxy 3000 FS. The injection ports should be spaced approximately 6” to 24” apart depending on the crack width and the thickness of the concrete. The crack should also be sealed using SpecPoxy 3000 FS, overlapping the crack approximately 1-1/2” on both sides. After the ports and crack surface have cured, inject SpecPoxy 1000 with pressurized dispensing equipment or use cartridges. Consult SpecChem Technical Services for complete injection instructions.Bonding: As a structural adhesive, apply SpecPoxy 1000 neat and work it into the substrate. The glue line should not exceed 1/16”.
Meets ASTM C881 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

column102:
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F (4°C) prior to mixing or installation. Pre-mix each component separately, then mix one part of Part A with one part of Part B for three minutes using a low-speed drill motor with a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot lifeSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign material that may cause a problem with bonding. Abrasive blast cleaning and mechanical removal methods are recommended. All drilled holes must be cleaned out with a cylindrical bristle brush, removing all dust and loose material. Use clean, oil-free compressed air to blow out any remaining dust or debris prior to installation.Bonding: As a structural adhesive and bonding fresh concrete to hardened concrete, neatly apply SpecPoxy 2000 to the substrate with a brush, roller, or by spraying. SpecPoxy 2000 should be applied at the rate of 80 sq ft per gallon, or approximately 20 mils in thickness. While tacky, place the fresh concrete. If SpecPoxy 2000 is no longer tacky, remove any surface dirt or contaminants and apply another coat of product.Anchoring:  For use in anchoring dowels, bolts, reinforcing steel, etc., the depth of the hole should be approximately 9-15 times the bolt diameter. To provide optimum pull-out, the hole space (annulus) around the bolt should not exceed 1/8". The annulus should not exceed 1/4" without aggregate extension. Always dispense SpecPoxy 2000 into the anchoring hole, filling it from the bottom up. Insert the bolt or dowel by turning it slowly during insertion. The hole should be completely filled with epoxy and devoid of air pockets or voids.Patching Repairs: To produce a mortar for patching repairs, mix one to four parts by volume of clean, dry, well-graded silica sand to one part of SpecPoxy 2000. Mix thoroughly until all the sand is completely wet and evenly dispersed. Apply a prime coat over the area to be repaired with the neat mixed epoxy. Place the mortar, working it well into the surface before the prime coat becomes tack-free. Lifts should not exceed 1” in thickness.
Meets ASTM C881 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

column102:
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F (4°C) before mixing or installation. Premix each component separately, then mix one part of Part A with one part of Part B for three minutes using a low-speed drill motor with a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot lifeSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign material that may cause a problem with bonding. Abrasive blast cleaning and mechanical removal methods are recommended. Clean drilled holes with a cylindrical bristle brush to remove all dust and loose material. Use clean, oil-free compressed air to blow out any remaining dust or debris before installation.Bonding: As a structural adhesive and for bonding fresh concrete to hardened concrete, apply SpecPoxy 2000 into the substrate with a brush, roller, or spray. SpecPoxy 2000 should be applied at a rate of 80 sq ft per gallon or approximately 20 mils in thickness. Place fresh concrete while the epoxy is still tacky. If SpecPoxy 2000 is no longer tacky, clean the surface and reapply.Anchoring:  For dowels, bolts, and reinforcing steel, drill holes to a depth of 9-15 times the diameter of the bolt. Ensure the annulus (hole space around the bolt) does not exceed 1/8" and fill the hole from the bottom up with SpecPoxy 2000. Insert the bolt or dowel by turning it slowly during insertion, ensuring the hole is completely filled with epoxy without air pockets or voids.Patching Repairs: To create a mortar for patching, mix one part of SpecPoxy 2000 with four parts of clean, dry, well-graded silica sand by volume. Apply a prime coat with the neat mixed epoxy, then place the mortar before the prime coat becomes tack-free. Keep lifts at or below 1" in thickness.

Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign material that may cause a problem with bonding. Abrasive blast cleaning and mechanical removal methods are recommended. Clean drilled holes with a cylindrical bristle brush to remove all dust and loose material. Use clean, oil-free compressed air to blow out any remaining dust or debris before installation.Bonding: As a structural adhesive and for bonding fresh concrete to hardened concrete, apply SpecPoxy 2000 LPL into the substrate with a brush, roller, or spray. SpecPoxy 2000 LPL should be applied at a rate of 80 sq ft per gallon or approximately 20 mils in thickness. Place fresh concrete while the epoxy is still tacky. If SpecPoxy 2000 LPL is no longer tacky, clean the surface and reapplyPatching:  To create a mortar for patching, mix one part of SpecPoxy 2000 LPL with four parts of clean, dry, well-graded silica sand by volume. Apply a prime coat with the neat mixed epoxy, then place the mortar before the prime coat becomes tack-free. Keep lifts at or below 1" in thickness.
ASTM C881 compliant

column102:
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 60°F before mixing or installation. To assist with mixing and dispensing, precondition the material to 75°F. For bulk applications, mix equal volumes of Part A and Part B for three minutes with a low-speed drill motor using a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot life. For cartridges, the resin and hardener are uniformly dispensed and mixed simultaneously through a mixing nozzleSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign matter by sandblasting, mechanical abrasion, or hydro-blasting. All drilled holes must be cleaned out with a nylon brush to remove all dust and loose material. Use clean, oil-free compressed air to blow out any remaining water, dust, or debris before application. Bolts, rebar, or threaded rods should be free of dirt, grease, oil, or other foreign materials.Bonding: As a structural adhesive, apply SpecPoxy 3000 FS neat and work it into the substrate. The glue line should not exceed 1/8”.Anchoring:  For anchoring dowels, bolts, or reinforcing steel, the hole depth should be approximately nine times the bolt diameter. The hole diameter should be approximately 1/8” larger than the threaded rod diameter. Ensure the holes are properly prepared (drilled, brushed, and blown out) before preparing the epoxy cartridge. Insert the cartridge into the dispensing gun. Place the mixing nozzle onto the cartridge, dispense the material, and ensure the epoxy flows uniformly without streaks. Dispense into the hole from the bottom up, filling approximately 5/8 of the hole depth while slowly withdrawing the nozzle. Insert the bolt or dowel by turning it slowly during insertion. After insertion, the hole should be completely filled with SpecPoxy 3000 FS and devoid of air pockets or voids. Do not disturb or bolt up until curedInto Hollow Block:  Completely fill the screen with epoxy while withdrawing the nozzle. Insert the epoxy-filled screen into the hole and insert the threaded rod to the bottom of the screen while turning slightly clockwise. Do not disturb or bolt up until cured.
Meets ASTM C881 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

column102:
Recommended for:- Bonding concrete, steel, and wood- Gravity feed or pressure injection crack repairs- Anchoring bolts, dowels, and reinforcing barMixing: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F prior to mixing or installation. Precondition the material to 75°F to assist with mixing and dispensing. For bulk applications, mix two parts of component A and one part of component B by volume for three minutes using a low-speed drill motor with a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot life. For cartridges, the resin and hardener are uniformly dispensed and mixed simultaneously through a mixing nozzleSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign matter by sandblasting, mechanical abrasion, or oil-free compressed air. For pressure injection, prepare the surface adjacent to the cracks to expose clean, sound concrete.Crack Injection: Injection ports should be fastened to the surface of the concrete using SpecPoxy 3000 FS. The injection ports should be spaced approximately 6” to 24” apart depending upon the crack width and the thickness of the concrete. The crack should also be sealed using SpecPoxy 3000 FS, overlapping the crack approximately 1-1/2” on both sides. After the ports and crack surface have cured, inject SpecPoxy 500 with pressurized dispensing equipment or use cartridges.Bonding: As a structural adhesive, apply the SpecPoxy 500 neat and work it into the substrate. The glue line should not exceed 1/16” (approximately 75 sq-ft per gallon).
Meets ASTM C881 standards, solvent-free, VOC content = 0 g/L.

Bolts, rebar, or threaded rods should be free of dirt, grease, oil, or other foreign materials.Bonding: As a structural adhesive, apply SpecPoxy 3000 FS neat and work into the substrate. The glue line should not exceed 1/8”.Anchoring:  For anchoring dowels, bolts, or reinforcing steel, the hole depth should be approximately nine times the bolt diameter. The hole diameter should be approximately 1/8” larger than the threaded rod diameter. Ensure the holes are properly prepared (drilled, brushed, and blown out) before preparing the epoxy. Insert the cartridge into the dispensing gun and place the mixing nozzle onto the cartridge. Dispense into a disposable container until a uniform grey is achieved with no streaks.Into Concrete: Dispense the material from the bottom of the hole. Fill approximately 5/8 of the hole depth while slowly withdrawing the nozzle. Insert the bolt or dowel by turning it slowly during insertion. After insertion, the hole should be completely filled with SpecPoxy 3000 FS and devoid of air pockets or voids. Do not disturb or bolt up until curedInto Hollow Block:  Completely fill the screen while withdrawing the nozzle. Insert the epoxy-filled screen into the hole. Insert the threaded rod to the bottom of the screen while turning slightly clockwise. Do not disturb or bolt up until cured.
Meets ASTM C881 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

Insert the cartridge into the dispensing gun and place the mixing nozzle onto the cartridge. Dispense into a disposable container until a uniform grey is achieved with no streaks.Into Concrete: Dispense the material from the bottom of the hole. Fill approximately 5/8 of the hole depth while slowly withdrawing the nozzle. Insert the bolt or dowel by turning it slowly during insertion. After insertion, the hole should be completely filled with SpecPoxy 3000 FS and devoid of air pockets or voids. Do not disturb or bolt up until curedInto Hollow Block:  Completely fill the screen while withdrawing the nozzle. Insert the epoxy-filled screen into the hole. column102:
Recommended for:- Bonding concrete, steel, and wood- Gravity feed or pressure injection crack repairs- Anchoring bolts, dowels, and reinforcing barsMixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F prior to mixing or installation. Precondition material to 75°F to assist with mixing and dispensing. For bulk applications, mix two parts of component A and one part of component B by volume for three minutes using a low-speed drill motor with a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot life. For cartridges, the resin and hardener are uniformly dispensed and mixed simultaneously through a mixing nozzleSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and other foreign matter by sandblasting, mechanical abrasion, or oil-free compressed air. For pressure injection, prepare the surface adjacent to the cracks to expose clean, sound concrete.Crack Injection: Injection ports should be fastened to the surface of the concrete using SpecPoxy 3000 FS. The injection ports should be spaced approximately 6” to 24” apart depending upon the crack width and the thickness of the concrete. Seal the surface of the crack using SpecPoxy 3000 FS, overlapping the crack approximately 1-1/2” on both sides. After the ports and crack surface have cured, inject SpecPoxy 500 with pressurized dispensing equipment or use cartridges.Bonding: As a structural adhesive, apply SpecPoxy 500 neat and work it into the substrate. The glue line should not exceed 1/16” (approximately 75 sq-ft per gallon).
Meets ASTM C881 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

column102:
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F (4°C) before mixing or installation. Premix each component separately, then mix one part of Part A with one part of Part B for three minutes with a low-speed drill motor using a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot life. For epoxy mortar, slowly add 3.5 to 5 parts clean, dry silica sand to 1 part of mixed SpecPoxy Binder and mix thoroughlySurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign material that may cause a bonding issue. Abrasive blast cleaning and mechanical removal methods are recommended. All drilled holes must be cleaned out with a cylindrical bristle brush, removing all dust and loose material. Use clean, oil-free compressed air to blow out any remaining dust or debris before installationEpoxy Mortar:  First, clean and prime the area with neat SpecPoxy Binder. Then apply the SpecPoxy Mortar by trowel or vibrating screed while the primer is still tacky. For broadcast overlays, apply the neat SpecPoxy Binder with a 3/16” notched squeegee, covering approximately 75-100 sq ft per gallon. Broadcast clean, dry aggregate at a rate of 2 pounds per square foot, or to the point of rejection. After curing, remove the excess aggregate and apply a second coat or seal if required.
ASTM C881 compliant

column120: If the epoxy is no longer tacky during bonding operations, reapply after removing surface contaminants. Do not thin with any solvents. Surface, ambient air, and material temperatures must be 40°F (4°C) or above. Do not expose uncured product to freezing temperatures below 35°F (1°C) or over 90°F (32°C). Epoxies may yellow, discolor, or chalk upon exposure to UV radiation, including sunlight or certain types of industrial lighting. Follow precautions found in the Safety Data Sheets (SDS), product labels, and technical literature.

Premix each component separately, then mix one part of Part A with one part of Part B for three minutes with a low-speed drill motor using a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot lifeSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Use clean, oil-free compressed air to blow out any remaining dust or debris before installationEpoxy Mortar:  Slowly add 3.5 to 5 parts of clean, dry silica sand to one part of mixed SpecPoxy Binder and mix thoroughly, completely wetting out and encapsulating all of the sand with epoxy resin. For mortar overlays and patching, first clean and prime the prepared substrate with neat SpecPoxy Binder. Then apply the epoxy mortar by trowel or a vibrating screed while the primer coat is still tacky. For broadcast overlays, apply the neat SpecPoxy Binder with a 3/16” (5mm) notched squeegee, covering approximately 75-100 sq ft per gallon. Broadcast clean, dry aggregate at a rate of 2 pounds per square foot, or to the point of rejection. After curing, remove the excess aggregate and apply either a second application or a seal coat, if required.
ASTM C881 compliant

column102:
Mixing Instructions: Air and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 45°F before mixing or installation. Condition the material to a minimum of 65°F prior to mixing or installation. Premix each component separately, then mix one part of Part A with one part of Part B for three minutes using a low-speed drill motor with a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot lifeSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be bonded must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign material that may cause bonding problems. Optimum adhesion is achieved by creating an open, profiled/roughened surface, similar to coarse sandpaper. Shot-blasting or mechanical methods are recommended. Thoroughly vacuum up any remaining dust or debris prior to installationBroadcast Overlays:  Apply the neat SpecPoxy Bridge Overlay (SBO) with a 3/16” notched squeegee (approximately 32-64 sq ft per gallon, depending on specification). Then broadcast clean, dry aggregate after the epoxy coating has leveled out. A silica sand of 20-40 gradation is recommended for the broadcast aggregate. Apply the aggregate according to the specification or at a rate of 2 pounds per square foot, or to the point of rejection. After the SBO has cured hard, remove the excess aggregate and apply a second application if necessaryEpoxy Mortar:  Slowly add from 3.5 to 5 parts of clean, dry silica sand to one part of mixed SBO and mix thoroughly, completely wetting out all the sand with epoxy resin. For mortar overlays and patching, first clean and prime the prepared substrate with neat SBO. Then apply the epoxy mortar by trowel or vibrating screed while the primer coat is still tacky.
ASTM C881 compliant

column120: Do not thin with any solvents. Surface and ambient air temperatures must be 45°F or above. Do not expose uncured product to temperatures below 35°F or above 90°F. Uncovered epoxies may yellow, discolor, or chalk upon exposure to UV radiation. High temperatures will accelerate the setting time, and cool temperatures will slow it down. Follow safety precautions in the Safety Data Sheets (SDS) and technical literature.

column102:
Surface Preparation - New Concrete: Ensure joints are clean and free of curing compounds, sealers, or other foreign substances. Use sandblasting or wire brushing as necessary. Before applying SpecPoxy CJ, remove water and dust with an oil-free blast.Surface Preparation - Old Concrete: Old joints should be routed to remove existing materials and widen the joint if necessary. Use fine sand to plug shrinkage cracks, maintaining a 2:1 depth-to-width ratio and allowing at least a 1” full-depth pour.Mixing Instructions: Temperature must be 50°F or above. Mix each component separately, then combine Part A with Part B, mixing for at least three minutes using a low-speed drill motor equipped with a Jiffy mixer or paddle.Application: SpecPoxy CJ can be applied with a caulking gun or poured from a container. Two passes may be necessary. Overfill the joint and grind or cut flush to the surface once the material is tack-free.
Meets ACI 302 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

Mix each component separately, then combine Part A with Part B, mixing for at least three minutes using a low-speed drill motor equipped with a Jiffy mixer or paddle.Application: SpecPoxy CJ can be applied with a caulking gun or poured from a container. Two passes may be necessary. Overfill the joint and grind or cut flush to the surface once the material is tack-free.
Meets ACI 302 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.
column106:
SpecPoxy CJ is a two-component, semi-rigid epoxy designed for filling control and construction joints in industrial concrete floors. This product supports joint edges and reduces spalling caused by wheel traffic. SpecPoxy CJ complies with ACI 302, section 4.10 recommendations for epoxy joint fillers used in sawcut/control joints.
Actual/Maximum VOC content = 0 grams per Liter.

column120: Test a small amount of SpecPoxy CJ before proceeding to ensure proper mixing and hardening. Do not thin with solvent. Minimum application temperature is 50°F. SpecPoxy CJ should not be installed until the building is under permanent temperature control, and it should not be used as an expansion joint sealant. Epoxies may discolor or chalk under UV exposure. Follow all precautions in the Safety Data Sheets (SDS) and technical literature.

column102:
Surface Preparation - New Concrete: Ensure joints are clean and free of curing compounds, sealers, and other foreign substances. Sandblast or wire brush if necessary. Before applying SpecPoxy CJ, remove water and dust with an oil-free blast.Surface Preparation - Old Concrete: Old joints should be routed to remove old material and to widen the joint if necessary. Use fine sand to plug shrinkage cracks, allowing at least a 1" full-depth pour and maintaining a 2:1 depth-to-width ratio.Mixing Instructions: The temperature of SpecPoxy CJ must be 50°F or above during mixing. Mix each component separately, then mix Part A with Part B for at least three minutes using a low-speed electric drill motor equipped with a Jiffy mixer or paddle.Application: SpecPoxy CJ can be applied using a caulking gun or poured from a container. Two passes may be required due to material settling. Overfill the joint and, once SpecPoxy CJ is tack-free, grind or cut it flush with the concrete surface. A heat flame can help if the material is fully hardened. The cut joint must be flush with the floor to effectively transfer wheel loads.
Meets ACI 302 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

column120: Test a small amount of SpecPoxy CJ before proceeding to verify proper mixing and hardening. Do not thin with solvent. The minimum application temperature is 50°F. Do not apply over standing water or use it as an expansion joint sealant. SpecPoxy CJ should not be installed until maximum shrinkage has occurred (recommended minimum of three months for semi-rigid epoxies). Epoxies may yellow or chalk when exposed to UV light. Keep away from food and food containers.

Two passes may be required due to the material settling. Overfill the joint, and once the SpecPoxy CJ is tack-free, grind or cut it flush with the concrete surface. A heat flame may facilitate cutting if the SpecPoxy CJ has fully hardened. The cut joint must be flush with the floor to effectively transfer wheel loads.
ASTM C881 compliant

column102:
Surface Preparation - New Concrete: Joints must be clean and free of curing compounds, sealers, and any other foreign substances. To remove these, sandblast or wire brush. Before applying SpecPoxy CJ, remove water and dust with an oil-free blast.Surface Preparation - Old Concrete: Old joints should be routed to remove existing material and widen the joint if necessary. column102:
Surface Preparation: New concrete must be at least 28 days old and possess an open surface texture with all curing compounds and sealers removed. The concrete must be clean and sound. Remove all oil, dirt, paint, and unsound concrete. Prepare the surface mechanically using sandblast, shotblast, or scarifier, which will give an open surface profile with the cement paste removed.The above surface preparation is recommended by SpecChem. Acid etching is acceptable only when mechanical preparation is impractical. Contractors experienced in the acid etching process may use this means of preparation, but the salts of the reaction must be thoroughly pressure-washed away. Allow the concrete to dry completely. Note: Acid etching may not provide as strong a bond as mechanical preparation. It will not remove oil, grease, or sealers that may interfere with bonding.Mixing: All materials should be in the temperature range of 60°F to 90°F. Mix Part A and Part B separately for one minute using a drill and mixing prop. For ease of mixing, add Part B to Part A (not the reverse). Mix Part A and Part B together for three minutes. The epoxy must be well mixed to ensure a proper chemical reaction. After mixing, place immediately.
Meets ASTM C881 standards, VOC content = 0 g/L.

column120:
Store and condition the product indoors at 50°F to 80°F prior to application. Avoid application at air and floor temperatures below 50°F and high humidity conditions.

  Suitable for service temperature from 40°F to 90°F

  Avoid applications with moisture vapor readings above 4 lbs per sq-ft

  Use in a well ventilated area, keep away from sparks and open flames

  Product may yellow with exposure to strong UV environments

  Epoxy components may cause irritation. Avoid contact with eyes and skin

  Apply only over dry concrete surfaces

  Do not apply over hardened primer or old epoxy without proper surface preparation

  Not recommended over new concrete less than 28 days old

  If HVAC intake ducts will distribute epoxy odor into adjoining occupied areas of the building, care should be taken to block these ventilation vents

column183: High-build, 100% solids epoxy coating for concrete surfaces

column102:
Concrete Surface Preparation: New Concrete must be a minimum of 28 days old and possess an open surface texture with all curing compounds and sealers removed. The concrete must be clean and sound. All oil, dirt, debris, paint and unsound concrete must be removed. The surface should be prepared mechanically using sandblast, shotblast or scarifier, which will give an open surface profile.
Acid etching is acceptable only when mechanical preparation is impractical. The salts left by the acid reaction must be thoroughly removed by pressure washing. Allow the concrete to completely dry. NOTE: Even with proper procedures, an acid etched surface may not provide as strong a bond as mechanical preparation procedures. Also, acid etching will not remove oil, grease, sealers and other materials that will interfere with the bond on the surface of the concrete.
Steel Surface Preparation: All metal surfaces to be coated must be free of contaminants such as paint, oil and grease and sand blasted down to white metal.
Joints and Edges: If the floor is subjected to heavy wheel traffic, the edges of the floor should be sawcut 1/4” deep to locked in the edge. Moving joints as in the case of expansion joints should be maintained through the coating. All cracks over 1/16” wide should be filled. Use a 100% solids epoxy mortar to fill wide cracks, joints and keyed edges.
Mixing: All materials should be conditioned to temperature range of 60°F to 90°F. Mix parts A and part B separately for one minute using a drill and mixing prop. For ease of mixing, add 1 Part B to 2 Parts A (not the reverse). Mix the Part A and Part B together for 3 minutes. The epoxy must be well mixed to ensure proper chemical reaction. After mixing, place immediately.
Placement: This product may be applied by notched squeegee or roller. After application, it is suggested the coating be back rolled with a spiked roller to reduce surface imperfections, entrapped air and to improve bond.
Top Coat: If desired, additional coats of this product or another SpecChem product may be applied just after the initial coating has become tack-free. This could be as early as 4 hours, but must be within 18 hours of initial coating placement. The choice of topcoat is selected based upon chemical and wear resistance desired. Contact your local SpecChem for specific recommendations.

column106:
SPECPOXY COATING CLEAR is a 2-component, high-performance epoxy coating system designed to provide concrete and steel surfaces with excellent abrasion resistance in combination with protection against chemical attack. These outstanding properties are further enhanced by the availability of a selection of colors for superior aesthetic benefits. (Standard Gray, Clear, Red, Beige and Black)
Applications on concrete or steel for SPECPOXY COATING CLEAR are:

  Food/chemical processing plants
  Auto/truck repair bays
  Warehouse floors
  Manufacturing plants
  Floor restoration projects

column158:
Store and condition the product indoors at 50°F to 80°F prior to application. Avoid application at air and floor temperatures below 50°F and high humidity conditions.

  Suitable for service temperature from 40°F to 90°F

  Avoid applications with moisture vapor readings above 4 lbs per sq-ft

  Use in a well ventilated area, keep away from sparks and open flames

  Product may yellow with exposure to strong UV environments

  Epoxy components may cause irritation. Avoid contact with eyes and skin

  Apply only over dry concrete surfaces

  Do not apply over hardened primer or old epoxy without proper surface preparation

  Not recommended over new concrete less than 28 days old

  If HVAC intake ducts will distribute epoxy odor into adjoining occupied areas of the building, care should be taken to block these ventilation vents

column171: Recubrimiento epóxico de alto espesor 100% sólidos

column102:
Surface Preparation: New concrete must be a minimum of 28 days old and possess an open surface texture with all curing compounds and sealers removed. The concrete must be clean and sound. All oil, dirt, debris, paint, and unsound concrete must be removed. The surface should be prepared mechanically using sandblast, shotblast, or scarifier, which will give an open surface profile with the cement paste removed.The above surface preparation is recommended by SpecChem. Acid etching is acceptable only when mechanical preparation is impractical. Only contractors experienced in the acid etching process should use this method. The salts from the reaction must be thoroughly pressure-washed away. Allow the concrete to completely dry. Note: Even with proper procedures, an acid-etched surface may not provide as strong a bond as mechanical preparation. Acid etching will not remove oil, grease, sealers, or other materials that may interfere with bonding.Mixing: All materials should be in the proper temperature range of 60°F to 90°F. Mix parts A and B (resin and hardener) separately for one minute using a drill and mixing prop. For ease of mixing, add Part B to Part A (not the reverse). Mix Part A and Part B together for three minutes. The epoxy must be well-mixed to ensure a proper chemical reaction. After mixing, place immediately.
ASTM C881 compliant

column102:
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F before mixing or installation. Precondition material to 75°F to assist with mixing and dispensing. For bulk applications, mix three parts of component A and one part of component B by volume for three minutes with a low-speed drill motor using a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot life. Slowly add part C (aggregate) and mix for an additional 2-3 minutesSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be grouted must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign matter by sandblasting, mechanical abrasion, or oil-free compressed air. For pressure injection, prepare the surface adjacent to the cracks to expose clean, sound concrete.Placing: The mixed grout should be poured continuously in a manner that provides full and complete contact with the base plate, free of air voids. Strapping will facilitate moving the grout into position. Grout should be placed at a minimum of 1.0" (2.54 cm) thick up to a maximum of 6" (15.2 cm) thick per lift in a large mass. Anchor bolt holes should be dry and free of all dust and debris before grout placement.
ASTM C881 compliant

column120: Always test a small amount of SpecPoxy Grout to verify thorough mixing and proper hardening before proceeding. Do not thin with any solvent. Surface and air temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F for application. Prolonged or repeated skin or eye contact may cause irritation. Use safety glasses and wear protective rubber gloves. In case of skin contact, wash immediately with soap and water. If eye contact occurs, flush immediately with water and seek medical help. If ingested, call a physician. Avoid breathing vapors.

column102:
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F prior to mixing or installation. Precondition the material to 75°F for optimal mixing. For bulk applications, mix three parts of component A and one part of component B by volume for three minutes with a low-speed drill motor using a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Slowly add part C (aggregate) and mix for an additional 2-3 minutesSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be grouted must be clean and structurally sound. For pressure injection, prepare the surface adjacent to the cracks to expose clean, sound concrete.Placing: Pour the mixed grout continuously to ensure full and complete contact with the base plate, free of air voids. Ensure anchor bolt holes are dry and free of all dust and debris before placement.

Surface and air temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F for application. Prolonged or repeated skin or eye contact may cause irritation. Use safety glasses and wear protective rubber gloves. If skin contact occurs, wash immediately with soap and water and seek medical help if needed. If eye contact occurs, flush immediately with water and seek medical help. In case of ingestion, call a physician. Avoid breathing vapors.

column149:
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F prior to mixing or installation. To assist with mixing and dispensing, precondition the material to 75°F. For bulk applications, mix three parts of component A and one part of component B by volume for three minutes with a low-speed drill motor using a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot life. Slowly add part C (aggregate) and mix for an additional 2-3 minutesSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be grouted must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign matter by sandblasting, mechanical abrasion, or oil-free compressed air. For pressure injection, prepare the surface adjacent to the cracks to expose clean, sound concrete.Placing: The mixed grout should be poured continuously and in such a manner as to provide full and complete contact with the base plate, free of air voids. Strapping will facilitate moving the grout into position. Grout should be placed at a minimum of 1.0” (2.54 cm) thick up to a maximum of 6” (15.2 cm) thick per lift in a large mass. Anchor bolt holes should be dry and free of all dust and debris before grout placement.
ASTM C881 compliant
column150: SpecPoxy Grout HS is a three-component, 100% solids, multi-purpose, very high-strength, non-shrink epoxy grout. The system combines a high-quality epoxy resin and curing agent with an engineered blend of graded aggregates, specifically engineered to provide superior grouting characteristics.Actual VOC content = 0 grams per liter

If skin contact occurs, wash immediately with soap and water and seek medical help if needed. If eye contact occurs, flush immediately with water and seek medical help. In case of ingestion, call a physician. Avoid breathing vapors.

column102:
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 40°F prior to mixing or installation. Precondition material to 75°F to assist with mixing and dispensing. Mix three parts of component A with one part of component B for three minutes using a low-speed drill motor and Jiffy mixer or paddle. Slowly add part C (aggregate) and mix for an additional 2-3 minutesSurface Preparation:  Surfaces to be grouted must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign matter by sandblasting, mechanical abrasion, or oil-free compressed air. Prepare surfaces adjacent to cracks for pressure injection by exposing clean, sound concrete.Placing: Pour the mixed grout continuously in a manner that ensures full and complete contact with the base plate, free of air voids. Use strapping to move the grout into position. Grout should be placed at a minimum thickness of 1.0" (2.54 cm) and up to a maximum thickness of 6" (15.2 cm) per lift in a large mass. Ensure anchor bolt holes are dry and free of dust and debris before placement.

column102:
Surface Preparation: Surfaces to receive mortar must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and other foreign substances through sandblasting, mechanical abrasion, or oil-free compressed air.Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be between 50°F and 90°F prior to mixing or installation. Precondition material to 70°F to aid mixing and dispensing. Mix each component separately, then combine one part of component A with one part of component B by volume and mix for 2-3 minutes using a low-speed drill motor and Jiffy mixer or paddle. Slowly add part C (aggregate) and mix until all aggregates are coated with epoxy.Placing: For mortar overlays or patching, apply the mixed epoxy mortar using a trowel or rake within 30-40 minutes. The pot life is approximately 60 minutes at 70°F. Use Solvent 100 as a finishing aid to lubricate the trowel for a smooth finish.
ASTM C881 compliant

column102:
Surface Preparation: Surfaces to receive mortar must be clean and structurally sound. Remove all oil, grease, dirt, laitance, curing compounds, and any other foreign matter by sandblasting, mechanical abrasion or oil free compressed air.
Mixing Instructions: Air, material, and surface temperatures must be a minimum of 50°F and maximum of 90°F prior to mixing or installation. To assist with mixing and dispensing, precondition material to 70°F. Mix each component separately, then mix one part of component A and one part of component B by volume for 2-3 minutes with a low speed drill motor using a Jiffy mixer or paddle. Mix only as much material as can be used within the pot life. Slowly add part C (aggregate) and mix until all aggregates are coated with epoxy.
Placing: For mortar overlays or patching, apply the mixed epoxy mortar with a trowel or rake immediately or within 30-40 min. Allow remaining work time for finishing. Use Solvent 100 as a finishing aid to lubricate the trowel allowing a smooth epoxy finish. Broadcast additional dry sand into the wet mortar to increase texture for improved traction.

column120: Always test a small amount of SpecPoxy Mortar to verify thorough mixing and proper hardening before proceeding. Do not thin with solvents. Surface and air temperatures must be a minimum of 50°F for application. Prolonged or repeated skin or eye contact may cause irritation. Use safety glasses and wear protective rubber gloves. In case of skin contact, wash immediately with soap and water. For eye contact, flush immediately with water and seek medical help. Avoid breathing vapors.

column102:
Surface Preparation: New concrete must be a minimum of 21-28 days old with all curing compounds and sealers removed. The concrete must be clean, dry, and sound. All oil, dirt, debris, paint, and unsound concrete must be removed. SpecPoxy Sealer is designed as a penetrating sealer. To ensure proper adhesion to a hard-troweled surface, a test section should be made to determine if additional surface profiling (shotblasting/etching) is required.Mixing: All materials should be conditioned to a temperature of 55°F to 80°F. Mix parts A and B (resin and hardener) separately for one minute using a drill and mixing prop. Then, mix Part A and Part B together for three minutes. The epoxy must be well mixed to ensure proper chemical reaction. Once mixed, immediately apply to the surface.Placement: This product may be applied by squeegee, roller, or industrial sprayer. When applying to seal hairline cracks, flood coat the surface and let the material pool over cracked areas for five minutes to ensure the cracks are filled. Squeegee or broom away any excess material from the surface. For improved skid resistance, broadcast clean, dry silica sand to refusal immediately after excess sealer has been removed from the surface. After the initial cure, remove excess sand. Due to variations in the porosity of concrete surfaces, SpecPoxy Sealer may create an irregular amber appearance if not applied uniformly. If desired, additional coats of this product may be applied after the initial sealer has become tack-free. This can occur as early as six hours but must be within 12 hours of initial placement.
WHMIS Classification: Class B2, D2B

column106:
SpecPoxy Sealer is a high-solids, two-component low viscosity penetrating epoxy sealer designed to protect new and existing concrete against deicing salts and chemical attack. SpecPoxy Sealer penetrates into the concrete pores to form a sub-surface seal that resists the penetration of liquid contaminants, chloride ions, and chemicals. Its low viscosity also makes it an excellent crack healer/sealer for many deteriorated concrete surfaces.Actual VOC = 345 grams per liter.
70% SOLIDS PENETRATING EPOXY SEALER

column102:
Use as a primer/bonding agent for underlayments, plaster, and stucco. Surfaces must be clean, structurally sound, and free of water, soluble materials, or contaminants before applying SpecPrime.
    
      Apply SpecPrime at a rate of 100–150 square feet per gallon. Coverage may vary depending on surface porosity. Apply with a brush, broom, or sprayer, and work the material into the surface. Drying time is typically two to three hours at 70°F, and SpecPrime will remain slightly tacky when dry. Remove accumulation in low areas. Use fans to improve air circulation and speed drying.
    
      Under normal conditions, SpecPrime can be applied up to 24 hours before underlayment installation. Keep jobsite traffic to a minimum until the underlayment is installed. For very porous surfaces, two applications may be necessary—allow two to three hours between coats. Reapply if a continuous film is not achieved.
column103:
Use as a primer/bonding agent for underlayments, plaster, and stucco. Surfaces must be clean, structurally sound, and free of water, soluble materials, or contaminants before applying SpecPrime.
    
      Apply SpecPrime at a rate of 100–150 square feet per gallon. Coverage may vary depending on surface porosity. Apply with a brush, broom, or sprayer, and work the material into the surface. Drying time is typically two to three hours at 70°F, and SpecPrime will remain slightly tacky when dry. Remove accumulation in low areas. Use fans to improve air circulation and speed drying.
    
      Under normal conditions, SpecPrime can be applied up to 24 hours before underlayment installation. Keep jobsite traffic to a minimum until the underlayment is installed. For very porous surfaces, two applications may be necessary—allow two to three hours between coats. Reapply if a continuous film is not achieved.
column106:
SpecPrime is a ready-to-use, rewettable primer designed to bond new concrete and SpecChem underlayments to horizontal concrete and other sound surfaces. Recommended for interior and dry applications only. Specifically formulated as a primer for SpecFlow.
    
Regulatory Compliance: SCAQMD Rule 1168; Adhesive   Sealant; Actual/Maximum VOC = 0 grams/liter, DO NOT THIN.

column120:
Do not allow to freeze.

Do not apply over frozen surfaces, water-soluble paints, rust, or peeling paints.

Do not apply where excessive hydrostatic pressure is present.

Protect SpecPrime film from dirt and other job site contaminants until topping is placed.

Follow all precautions found in SDS, product labels, and technical literature.

For very porous surfaces, two applications may be necessary—allow two to three hours between coats. Reapply if a continuous film is not achieved.

column102:
Agitate thoroughly before use. Application equipment must be clean and free of foreign materials. A spray application is the preferred method. Application temperatures above 40°F are recommended. Areas that are to be caulked should be masked. Do not pond or puddle. Coverage will vary depending on the texture and porosity of the concrete. Apply at a rate of 200-400 ft²/gal immediately after final trowel (or stripping of forms).
SPEC REZ is formulated as a dissipating type resin. The rate of dissipation is dependent upon climatic conditions, the rate of application and exposure to ultraviolet light. Under normal conditions, chemical and physical breakdown will start in 4-6 weeks.
Residual SpecRez may be removed with SpecChem Orange Peel Citrus Cleaner or any type of dry abrasive or sanding pad. The use of SpecRez does not eliminate the need to properly prepare the surface in accordance with the written instructions for the application of secondary toppings or coatings.
Tools and equipment may be cleaned with warm water and soap.

column120:
Do not apply at temperatures below 40°F (4°C).

  Keep from freezing. Do not dilute or alter in any way

  Always follow subsequent coating manufacturers’ recommendations for surface preparation.

  All resin cures turn yellow while they are dissipating (oxidizing). This is a normal part of the dissipation process.

  Broom finish concrete may prolong dissipation

  Keep out of the reach of children

  Use with adequate ventilation

  In case of ingestion, CALL A PHYSICIAN immediately. DO NOT induce vomiting.

  Can cause skin irritation upon contact, especially prolonged or repeated. If skin contact occurs, wash immediately with soap and water and seek medical help as needed.

  If eye contact occurs, flush immediately with clean water and seek medical help as needed.

  Read SDS before using product.

  DO NOT EXPOSE TO OR APPLY NEAR FIRE OR FLAMES. FOR WELL VENTILATED OR EXTERIOR USE ONLY!

column128: Eye Contact: If product enters the eyes, flush with plenty of water or eye wash solution for several minutes. Remove contacts if present and easy to do. Seek medical attention if irritation persists. / Contact avec les yeux : Si le produit pénètre dans les yeux, rincer abondamment à l'eau ou avec une solution pour les yeux pendant plusieurs minutes. Retirer les lentilles de contact si présentes et faciles à enlever. Consulter un médecin si l’irritation persiste. Skin Contact: Wash skin thoroughly with soap and water after handling. Seek medical attention if irritation develops and persists. / Contact avec la peau : Laver soigneusement la peau avec de l’eau et du savon après manipulation. Consulter un médecin si une irritation apparaît et persiste. Inhalation: If breathing becomes difficult, remove victim to fresh air. If necessary, use artificial respiration to support vital functions. Seek medical attention. / Inhalation : Si la respiration devient difficile, transporter la victime à l’air frais. Si nécessaire, effectuer la respiration artificielle pour soutenir les fonctions vitales. Consulter un médecin. Ingestion: If product is swallowed, call physician or poison center immediately. If professional advice is not available, do not induce vomiting. Never induce vomiting or give dilutents (milk or water) to someone who is unconscious, having convulsions, or who cannot swallow. Seek medical advice. Take a copy of the label and/or SDS with the victim to the health professional. / Ingestion : En cas d’ingestion, appeler immédiatement un médecin ou un centre antipoison. Si aucun avis professionnel n’est disponible, ne pas faire vomir. Ne jamais faire vomir ni donner de diluants (lait ou eau) à une personne inconsciente, en convulsions, ou incapable d’avaler. Consulter un médecin. Fournir une copie de l’étiquette et/ou de la fiche de données de sécurité au professionnel de la santé.
